Seeing this demand, she has plans to expand her business and build at least 3 additional rooms so she can earn more and maintain her spending needs for her old age. This will be her tenth loan with the MFP institution and she hope to continue with her objectives with this collaboration. She also notes that she feels good with her community bank since she considers the members to be good people. With the loan requested of 1500 new "soles" she will invest in the purchase of wood and strips to build at least 3 additional rooms.

loans.use: to purchase wood and strips of wood for the building of more rooms.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Sandra tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora como estibador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes y gallinas, también los días de feria se dedica al armado de casetas para las vendedoras de la feria. 

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de cuyes y gallinas. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Juventud".  She lives in the city of Cuenca which in December 1999 was designated as a World Heritage Site.  It is a place of extraordinary beauty, with natural and culture wealth and its people are kind and cordial and maintain their culture and traditions.

Sandra is 23 and lives with her common-law husband and their three-year-old daughter.  Her husband is a stevedor. They live in a rental house.

She sells guineas pigs and hens, and on holidays also sets up the stalls for the tradefairs.  This is her fourth loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy guinea pigs and hens.

Her goal is to have her own house some day.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is married, 31 years of age and has two children.

Elaine owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Elaine needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase chemicals such as gromozones and pesticides, shovels and a wheelbarrow for her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250 or USD $104 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Elaine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Elaine's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals such as gromozones and pesticides, shovels and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Gloria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy  fáciles para conseguir. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad que estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, en la cual vende desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en Montecristi y Manta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Lleva en su tienda ya por 5 años y le va bien ya que dia a dia trata de mejorarla.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, which is known for the diversity of its typical products such as the well-known Panama straw hat, the communal bank "Mi Banquito" meets every two weeks.

Mrs. Gloria is a founding member of the group which she likes because the loans are easy to obtain.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 14 and 7 who are in school.  Her husband is an artisan who works with ivory palm.

She has a store set up in her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents and even Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and some times even later.  She buys her products in Montecristi and Manta although most of the products are delivered.  She has been in business for five years and it going well since she tries to improve it everyday.

The loan she has requested will be used to restock the store.  She plans to buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

Her goal is to continue her business and keep expanding the store.

loans.use: To buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tofi

texts.en:
Tofi is married, 21 years of age and has one child.

Tofi owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Tofi needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase push knives, a wheelbarrow and pesticides. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or USD $125 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Tofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tofi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase push knives, wheelbarrow and pesticides

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
Asenati is married, 28 years of age with five children.

Asenati owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Asenati needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 200 or USD $83 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Asenati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Asenati's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 32 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días de la semana por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a sus clientes que trabajan durante el dia y además porque a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva 7 años dedicada a esta labor.

Ella está repitiendo su crédito con la institución ya que desde que recibe los créditos su situación ha mejorado mucho tanto en lo económico como en su vida familiar ya que los causantes de los problemas familiares es muchas veces la falta de recursos económicos. Nos cuenta que su negocio ha estado bastante bien y muchos más en este mes que es cuando las personas compran muchos regalos. En cuanto a sus pagos todos los realizo al día  y ahora está por recibir un nuevo crédito para seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal, de salud gracias a Dios está muy bien también, ella espera seguir contando con la ayuda de la institución y de Kiva.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos del banquito y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son tener un carro y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of traditional products. These include toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), which are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the Mi Banquito communal bank in that city meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Mrs. Gloria, 32, who is married and has a five-year-old son.  Her husband is a craftman who works with ivory palm.

She sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) by catalogue.  She works three days a week during the cool morning hours and in the evening when her customers are home from work.  This way her husband can take care of their son.  She sells door-to-door on an order basis, issuing credit and collecting payment weekly.  For seven years she has been in business.

She is taking out another loan through the institution because the support has helped her family economic situation.  Many times a lack of resources can cause family problems.  Her business has done well, especially this month when people are buying gifts.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  With the new loan she will be able to advance in her business and personal life.  She is thankful for her health and hopes to be able to continue depending on the institution and Kiva.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams. 

Her goal is to have a car and fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics and creams

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 58 years of age,married and has 11 children.

Eseta owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has five years of experience in this business. Eseta needs a loan of WST 2,200 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or USD $125 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Eseta's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Carmen Lucciola

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 5 años que  estudia en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él pueda financiar su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de granos como frejol, lentejas, maní, entre otros, trabaja cuatro días de la semana en el mercado de Manta,  lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios esto le ha dado para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar lentejas, frejol, maní, maíz, entre otros. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.

En la fotografía está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of traditional products. These include toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), which are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the Mi Banquito communal bank in that city meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Mrs. Carmen, 46, who is married and has three children, one of whom is an adult and the other two, 16 and 5, are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good homemaker who wants to help her husband with the household expenses by taking out a loan to finance his business.  He sells grains such as beans, lentils, peanuts, etc., working four days a week at the market in Manta.  He has been in business for 15 years and thankfully it is going well and allowing them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, and corn, among other things.  She is a founding member of the communal bank which she enjoys because the institution's interest rate is lower than anywhere else.

Her dream is to have good health and continue striving to get ahead.

In the photograph she appears with her son.

loans.use: To buy lentils, beans, peanuts, corn, etc.

loans.name: Lely

texts.es: Lely, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial, está casada con Elías quien es técnico dental, vive en compañía de su esposo, su hija de 17 años  de edad y su dos nietos de 15 y 12 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa de su propiedad. El negocio que tiene Lely es la elaboración de ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños de todos los modelos que le solicitan, para eso se inició con un maquina de coser que compró con un préstamo de MFP, la cual instaló en su casa, donde atiende a todos sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. Ella estudió costura en un centro de educación ocupacional logrando crecer y en la actualidad cuenta con 03 maquinas, y en compañía de su hija, quien está aprendiendo. Le gusta su oficio, además del ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Viendo la buena acogida y las ganancias que le rinde, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio, y paralelo a eso piensa abrir otro negocio de venta de comidas rápida por las noches, como pollos broster y salchipapas. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como agujas de maquinas, hilos, telas y otros.
texts.en:
Lely, 50, is a hard-working, determined woman who is kind and cordial.  She is married to Elías, a dental technician, and they live with their 17-year-old daughter and two grandchildren, ages 15 and 12, in the comfort of their own home.  Lely is a seamstress and make women's, men's and children's clothing in the styles they request.  She began with a sewing machine that she bought with a loan through MFP that she set up in her home, where she attends to her customers in a kind, cordial manner.  

She studied sewing at a vocational education center and has been able to build her business and buy three machines.  Her daughter is also studying to be a seamstress.  She enjoys her work and the extra income which she uses to help her husband cover household expenses.  Seeing that her business is popular and earns a profit she wants to continue with it, while also opening a fast food business at night, selling roasted chicken and salchipapas (sausage and potatoes).  This is her sixth loan through MFP.  She is counting on your support so she can carry out her plans.  She is comfortable with her communal bank because she feels the members are all responsible.  The 1,500 PEN loan she requested will be used to buy sewing materials such as sewing machine needles, thread, fabric and other items.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine needles, thread and fabric.

loans.name: Fabiola Vanessa

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fabiola, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años  de edad. Su esposo es ayudante en un bus de transporte.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días de la semana más que todo en las mañanas, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Lleva dos años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren  a pesar de que hay mucha competencia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y  le gusta por la ayuda y los beneficios que recibe de la institución. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Los  Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great variety of local products, such as the Panama hat, renowned in and outside of the country. Here, the members of the communal bank “Mi Banquito” meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Fabiola who is 20 and married. She and her husband have a 2-year-old. Her husband is an assistant on a transport bus. 

She goes door to door selling all kinds of clothing. She also sells out of a small location in her home. She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs. She has been doing this work for 2 years, and it has gone really well since many clients prefer her in spite of all the competition. 

She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been part of the communal bank for three loan cycles. She likes it for the help and benefits it gives her. 

Her dreams are to advance in life and to continue with her sales.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Yony tiene 30 años edad y es conviviente y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella tiene diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores pero su actividad económica principal es trabajar en un hotel como cocinera. Yony trabaja desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días de lunes a domingos en el restaurante pero durante la semana le dan un día libre, ella aprendió el oficio de cocina por su propia cuenta de recetas y videos de cocina. Yony es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En  esta oportunidad Yony requiere el préstamo para hacer construir su casa y desea comprar yeso, cemento, madera, arena, tubos y focos. Su sueño de Yony es la abrir un restaurante en la ciudad de Urubamba.  

Yony es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Yony was born in Urubamba province and lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja which is in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Peru.

Yony is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She works in different business activities.  For example, she farms and also raises livestock.  However, her main business activity is working in a hotel as a cook.  Yony works from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day, from Monday to Sunday, in the restaurant but they give her a day off during the week.  She learned the cookery trade by herself, from recipes and cookery videos.  Yony is an enterprising and hard-working woman who provides for her family.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to build her house.  She would like to buy plaster, cement, wood, sand, pipes and light bulbs.  Her dream is to open a restaurant in the city of Urubamba.

Yony is a member of the 'Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja' (Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja) community bank.  This bank has 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja, which is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Marina Asuncion

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Marina  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco  hijos de 21, 17, 15, 10 y 6 años de edad, los tres menores estudian uno en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un bus de transporte.

Ella es artesana, se dedica a realizar eventos y  decoraciones para fiestas infantiles, bautizos, quinceañeras y todo compromiso social, todos  estos trabajos los elabora bajo pedidos de personas que solicitan de sus servicios. Además de esto en su casa tiene una pequeña heladería en la cual pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo ya que allí mismo elabora sus artesanías. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta labor y nunca le ha faltado trabajo. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar helados, y materiales para elaborar sus obras, como globos, cintas, serpentinas, etc.
 
Sus sueños son tener una gran heladería y un gran salón de eventos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mi Banquito' community bank meet in Los Bajos, in Montecristi.  This city is known for its wide variety of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hat.  Its products are known both at home and abroad.

Marina is a founding member of the community bank.  She is the group's rule enforcer and she likes the bank because of the facilities they have for obtaining loans.  She is 36 years old, married, and has five children aged 21, 17, 15, 10 and 6.  Her three youngest are in school.  One is in high school and the other two are in elementary school.  Her husband works on a bus.

Marina is a craftswoman.  She organizes events and decorations for children's parties, christenings, fifteenth birthday celebrations and all social engagements.  She does these jobs to order for people who request her services. In addition, she has a small ice-cream parlor in her home where she spends most of her time as that is where she makes her handicrafts.  She has been in this business for more than five years and has never been short of work.

Marina will use this loan to buy ice cream and materials for making her works such as balloons, ribbons, streamers, etc.  Her dreams are to have a large ice-cream parlor and a large events hall.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, balloons, ribbons, streamers, etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Soledad tiene 35 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella tiene diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como pollos pero su actividad económica principal es la venta de pollos. Ya son tres años que se dedica  a la venta de pollos y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Soledad es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En  esta oportunidad Soledad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos de color blanco, ella compra el par de pollitos a S/. 13.00 nuevos soles pero después de hacerlos crecer los vende cada uno a un precio de S/. 45.00 nuevos soles. Su sueño de Soledad que sus hijos se han profesionales y realicen como tales. 

Soledad es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in Urubamba province and lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This village is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Peru.

Soledad is 35 years old and lives with her partner.  The couple have four children.  Soledad works in different business activities.  For example, she farms and also raises animals such as chickens.  However, her main business activity is selling chickens.  She has been selling chickens for three years and her business is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  Soledad is an enterprising and hard-working woman who provides for her family.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy white chickens.  She buys each pair of chickens for 13.00 soles and, after raising them, she sells each one for 45.00 soles.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

Soledad is a member of the 'Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja' (Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja) community bank.  The group has 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 42 años de edad  es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y amable, está separada de su pareja, vive en compañía de madre y su hijo de 23 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Lucia es la venta de golosinas en un tablero que instala en el frontis de su casa todos los días. Iniciándose con un préstamo particular hace 3 años, logrando ganarse el aprecio y la preferencia de sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, gracias a su buena atención y manera amable de tratar,  además de contar con la ayuda de su madre para atender a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico adicional asimismo le permite socializarse con su vecinos, además de tener  una ocupación y sentirse productiva ya que cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo quien le da una mensualidad. Pero ella prefiere mantenerse ocupada para distraerse, y así sentirse tranquila, teniendo planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor para surtir su negocio, y con la diferencia desea comenzar con el negocio de abarrotes comprando de a poco.
texts.en:
42-year-old Lucia is a hard-working and keen woman.  She is also happy and friendly.  She is separated from her partner and lives together with her mother and her 23-year-old son.  They live comfortably together in her mother's home.  Lucia's business is selling candies from a board which she sets up out the front of her house every day.  She started out with a private loan three years ago and gained the esteem and loyalty of her customers, who are mainly her neighbors, thanks to the good customer service she provides and the friendly way in which she serves them.  She also has her mother's help in serving her customers.  Lucia enjoys her business as it makes her additional income and, at the same time, allows her to socialize with her neighbors.  It also gives her a job and makes her feel productive.  Lucia has the financial support of her son who provides her with a monthly allowance.  However, she prefers to keep busy as it makes her feel better.  Lucia has plans to expand her business and open a grocery store in her home.

This will be Lucia's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She says that she feels happy to be part of her community bank because she considers the other members to be friendly and responsible people.  She will invest the 1,500 soles that she has requested in buying candies wholesale so that she can stock her business.  She would like to use the remainder to start a grocery business, buying products gradually.

loans.use: to buy more candies wholesale and to buy basic household products in order to set up a grocery store

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Tomasa tiene 43 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella trabaja en un hotel donde realiza labores de limpieza, ordenar, lavandería, ella trabaja en tiempo completo ósea desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a domingos. Ya son tres años que trabaja y le va muy bien. Tomasa también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Tomasa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y también para la educación de sus hijos. Su sueño de Tomasa es abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 

Tomasa es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Tomasa was born in Urubamba province and lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This village is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Peru.

Tomasa is 43 years old, married, and has five children from this beautiful relationship.  She works in a hotel, cleaning, tidying and doing laundry.  She works full time, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.  She has been working for three years and is doing very well.  Tomasa also raises animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more animals such as guinea pigs, and to pay for her children's education.  Tomasa's dream is to open a grocery store.

Tomasa is a member of the 'Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja' (Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja) community bank.  This group has 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs, and to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Dios Prospera Group

texts.en:
Julia is the mother of eight children, three of whom live together with her and her long-term partner in their home. The family lives in a Batey near the city of La Romana. A Batey is a rural town built for the sugarcane industry workers.

Julia says her most favorites things to do are to work and to eat. Her most important challenge is to have her own house, built safe and comfortable. Since almost four years ago, Julia started her business with a loan she took. She bought a small amount of merchandise for resale. After eight loans, she has been able to expand her business, with more clients and more products.

Julia is receiving her ninth loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital to purchase sugar, candies, rice, fruits and vegetables. With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a big grocery store. She thanks you for supporting her and her group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy sugar, candies, rice, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La señora Ernestina de 49 años vive en una colonia popular de la localidad desde hace 15 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y ella en su domicilio instalo una área exclusiva para vender prendas de vestir usadas como lo son, blusas de dama, pantalones, sacos, camisa de caballero y ropa de niño ella vende todos los días ya que esta su principal fuente de ingres; o su esposo se encuentra trabajando en estados unidos y es muy complicado para Ernestina depender al cien porciento de los ingresos de su esposo la vida haya es más cara y cuando se termina el trabajo la Señora Ernestina tiene que esperar a que el se acomode para poder recibir un ingreso por parte de el, esta fue la principal motivación para que ella pudiera emprender su negocio  de esto ya hace cuatro años y ella requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía de temporada como lo son: chaquetas, pantalones, sudaderas, tenis, bufandas y más variedad de productos.
texts.en: 49-year-old Ernestina has been living in a 'colonia popular' (urban poor and working-class neighborhood) for 15 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and has set up an area in her home where she sells used clothing such as ladies' blouses, pants, bags, men's shirts and children's clothing.  She sells every day as this is her main source of income.  Her husband is working in the USA and it is very complicated for Ernestina to have to depend completely on her husband's income.  Life is becoming more expensive and when Ernesta lost her job, she had to wait for her husband to get settled so that she could receive an income from him.  This was her main motivation to start her business.  She has been working in her business for four years and she needs support so that she can buy seasonal merchandise such as jackets, pants, sweatshirts, sneakers, scarves and a wider range of products.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El sr. Mateo de 46 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él y de su esposa, el tiene 7 años viviendo en una casa de interés social, trabaja como operador en una maquiladora de la localidad 10 horas diarias de lunes  a viernes su esposa contribuye a los gastos del hogar y al igual que el trabaja en una maquiladora.
Mateo es un esposo y padre  que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia,  tiene una la cual es madre soltera y que está viviendo en casa de el;  las viviendas de interés social son muy pequeñas  y apenas si tienen un espacio para cuatro personas es por ello que Mateo se preocupa por que su hija y nietos estén en un lugar cómodo y le está construyendo una recamara para ella y para sus niños y solicita el apoyo para terminar la construcción de un cuarto que el inicio hace 5 años y por cuestiones económicas no ha podido realizar.
texts.en:
46-year-old Mateo is married and has two children who are still financially dependent on himself and his wife.  He has been living in government-subsidized housing for seven years.  Mateo works as a laborer in a cross-border assembly plant in his town.  He works 10 hours a day, from Monday to Friday.  His wife contributes toward their household expenses and also works in an assembly plant.

Mateo is a husband and father who cares about his family's well-being.  One of his children is a single mother and is living at home with him.  Government-subsidized houses are very small and barely have enough space for four people.  Mateo would like his daughter and grandchildren to live comfortably and so he is building a room for her and her children.  He is requesting support so that he can finish building the room which he started five years ago but, for financial reasons, has been unable to finish.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe de 40 años es casada y madre de dos hijos una niña de trece años y un joven de diez y ocho años que aun dependen económicamente de ella y su esposos, ella vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 11 años cuando ellos se cambiaron a esta casa La señora Mary estaba ya cansada de las carencias económicas y de falta de atención que tenia para sus hijos ya que en ese entonces ellos tenias 2 y 7 años y ella decidió que tenia que hacer algo para apoyar los gastos del hogar sin tener que descuidar a sus hijos y esposo y fue de ahí que le surgió la idea de vender dulces, frituras, galletas, galletas refrescos y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para su familia y así poco a poco Mary fue teniendo una gran variedad de productos en su negocio y este ha sido la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia por ello es que La señora Mary solicita el apoyo para compra de mercancía y surtir negocio ella quiere estar preparada con los productos que mas se venden en esta temporada navideña y requiere el apoyo para compra de platos y vasos desechables, carbón, refrescos y frituras.
texts.en: 40-year-old María Guadalupe is married and has two children: a 13-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son.  Both children are still financially dependent on her and her husband.  Mary has been living in government-subsidized housing for 11 years.  When they moved to this house, Mary was already tired of their lack of financial resources and the lack of attention that they were able to give their children who were then 2 and 7 years old.  She decided that she had to do something to contribute towards their household expenses without neglecting her children and her husband.  This is when she had the idea to start selling sweet treats, fried food, cookies and soft drinks, thereby making an income for her family.  Mary gradually acquired a wide range of products for her business which has been the only source of income for her and her family.  For this reason, Mary is requesting support so that she can buy more merchandise and stock her business.  She wants to be prepared by having available the products that she sells the most of during the Christmas season.  She needs support to buy disposable plates and cups, charcoal, soft drinks and fried food.

loans.use: to buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks and dairy products for her business

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng, 50, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Veng sells groceries and her husband raises pigs.
 
Veng is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business of raising more pigs. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, 55, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Hun buys rice in bulk to resell when the price is profitable, and her husband sells palm juice. 

Hun is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase more rice to stock for resale. 

In the future, Hun would like to send her children to study Korean so that they can go to work in South Korea. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock for resale.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora que como toda la gente comienza desde abajo para poder vivir cómodamente,  cuenta que hace años trabajaba para una farmacia recibiendo un salario mínimo y que algunas ocasiones se quedaba sin su salario con tal de pagar el terreno de su casa y para construirla realizaba tandas. Para poder tener un ingreso más alto a pesar de que no tenía la preparación académica llego hacer coordinadora de una empresa que ofrece sus artículos por catalogó aproximadamente unos 20 años. Para Angélica este trabajo fue muy pesado pero le gustaba realizarlo con entusiasmo, en este momento dejo trabajar para alguien para iniciar su propio proyecto de vida y coloco una tienda de abarrotes y librería en su misma casa; donde ella pudiera atenderla y ser dueña. Este negocio será su fuente de ingresos por que comenta que ya no tiene la juventud y energía que tenía hace años, por tal motivo quiere comprar abarrotes, lácteos, tortillas, refrescos, biblias, casetes para que su negocio se encuentre abastecido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Angélica is a very hard-working woman who, like all people, worked her way up towards being able to live comfortably.  She says that, years ago, she used to work in a pharmacy, receiving the minimum wage and that sometimes she didn't receive her salary.  In order to buy land and build her house, she worked shifts.  In order to make better income, in spite of the fact that she didn't have the necessary education, she became a coordinator for a company that sells catalog products.  This was approximately 20 years ago.  That work was very difficult for Angélica but she liked to do it with enthusiasm.

Angélica stopped working for other people and decided to start her own life project.  She set up a grocery store and bookstore in her own home where she would be able to work and own her own business.  This business is her source of income as she says that she no longer has the youth and energy that she used to have years ago.  She would like to buy groceries, dairy products, tortillas, soft drinks, Bibles and cassettes so that her business is stocked with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy goods, Bibles, etc.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan Jesus es hombre muy trabajador y dedicado, hace 15 años por situaciones ajenas a el, perdió algunos dientes y desde ese tiempo se ha cuidado de no abrir tanto la boca cuando habla y hasta para reir por la pena de que alguien se burle de su estado. Para Juan José ha sido un trauma y un problema al comer ya que para masticar algún alimento se le dificulta y teme que por no moler correctamente la comida pueda ahogarse. En este momento el ve la oportunidad de arreglarse la dentadura lo cual le permitirá realizar actividades que por pena no ha hecho. Para esto necesita el dinero para ir con el dentista y le coloque lo que serán sus nuevos dientes.
texts.en: Juan Jesus is a hard working and dedicated man. Fifteen years ago, due to circumstances beyond his control, he lost some teeth. Since then he has been careful not to open his mouth when he talks and even when he laughs for fear someone will laugh at him. This has been traumatic for Juan Jose as well as a problem for eating because it is difficult for him to chew some food, and he is afraid he will choke because he can't chew properly. At this time, he sees the opportunity to fix his teeth, which will allow him to do activities that he hasn't been able to do. For that, he needs the money to go to the dentist so he can put in some new teeth.

loans.use: Ponerse la dentadura

loans.name: Chan Nary

texts.en:
Chan Nary, 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband travel around the village to purchase junk material from villagers to resell at the junk shop. 

Chan Nary is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for traveling to purchase the junk. In the future, she would like to run a junk shop of her own, build a small concrete house, and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for traveling to purchase the junk.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 47-year-old, married woman blessed with four school-age children. She is a very industrious woman because, aside from the farming business that serves as their main source of income, she also engages in hog fattening production. She does this work for her family. She wants to lift her family out of poverty and save for the education of her children. That’s why she is strong and enthusiastic for her work. 

For Erlinda to achieve her dream, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to develop her farming business. She just hopes to make a profit out of these inputs to lift up her family from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to develop her farming business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María  cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años para apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar. Rosa vende ropa, juguetes para niño y más a un precio cómodo para el público de acuerdo a su economía. La señora desea invertir en su negocio para que sus ventas sean incrementadas ya que es temporada navideña es cuando es más solicitada
texts.en: Rosa María has had a business selling used clothes for 5 years to help her husband with the family expenses. Rosa sells clothes, toys and more at a price that is comfortable for the public in this economy. She wants to invest in her business so that her sales will increase since it is the Christmas season when demand is the highest.

loans.use: to buy clothes for cold weather.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old, married, and has five adult children. She is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Juanita makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Juanita has been in this business for ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities.
 
Juanita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Savai

texts.en:
Savai, 22, is single and lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common. He is a farmer and also plants cassava to earn a living. He has been with this business for more than two years. Sometimes he works for others for a fee. He earns around five U.S. dollars per day and saves around four U.S. dollars daily for the future. 

Savai has been with VisionFund since 2009. The previous loans have made his living better and have helped him have regular income. 

Now requesting another loan, he wants to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income and savings so he can afford a decent house for living.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is married and resides with his wife and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He runs a business of buying and selling junk material. His wife is a housewife. 

Tam is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike to carry junk material to sell at the junk shop. In the future, he would like to run a small grocery store for his wife to sell from at home, build new house, and send his son to a mechanical training center.

loans.use: to puchase a motorbike to carry junk material to sell

loans.name: Noum

texts.en:
Noum, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Additionally, she carries some kinds of sweetcakes to sell around the village. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Noum is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to carry her cakes to sell. In the future, she plans to produce those cakes by herself. Moreover, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her cakes to sell

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
At 41 years old, Heng has three dependent children; two of them are workers at a rubber plantation factory while the last one is still in school. She has made a living as a farmer for 22 years and she supplements her income by working for others in the village. With her current source of income, she earns less than four U.S. dollars per day and saves two dollars per day. 

Heng has been with VisionFund since 2010 and now she has regular income after the loan. She and her group member, who has been with VisionFund since 2009, are applying for another loan. She wants to harvest her rice crop and use a portion of the loan to renovate her house. She hopes to make more rice and have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To harvest her rice crop and renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lorb

texts.en:
Lorb, 37, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She makes creel and other types of baskets. Her husband runs a business of buying and selling cattle. 

Lorb is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase two hectares of land to grow rice in order to generate more income. In the future, she would like to build a toilet and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase two hectares of land to grow rice

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 52 years old, widowed, and has two children, one of whom is a dependent working in a rubber plantation factory. Having earned a living as a widowed mother, she has been farming rice as her main income source for 35 years and she supplements her income by raising pigs. The previous loans from VisionFund since 2009 have helped Sok have a regular income. Now she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day. 

Sok leads a group of five female members who have been with VisionFund from one year to two years and are applying for another loan. She will use this loan to harvest her rice crop and buy a few piglets for her business. She hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To harvest her rice crops and buy a few piglets for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rer

texts.en: Rer, age 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a taxi driver who drives tourists to tourism sites. Rer is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. In the future, she would like to run a food store, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Karen Gale

texts.en:
Karen Gale is a 25-year-old, married woman with two children. For three years, she has been working as a farmer and earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every cropping season. She says that this is not enough as a cure for her difficulties, but she is not hopeless; instead, she has got the courage to continue her business.

Karen Gale is now applying for a 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of this loan, she plans to save for the education of her children and for the improvement of their living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun, age 51, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow mushrooms to sell at the market. Additionally, Vun grows rice to generate more income. Two of her children are employed as receptionists at a hotel. 

Vun is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase oxen to yoke in order to till her farming land and to carry her rice crop. In doing so, she can reduce her plowing service expense. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing mushrooms, renew her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase oxen to yoke in order to till her farming land.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 46, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Chea sells fruits, and her husband is a construction worker. Chea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland on which to grow watermelons and peanuts. 

In the future, Chea would like to use the additional income to purchase palm sugar to sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Chea appears in the photograph at KREDIT's office.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow watermelons and peanuts.

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Mrs. Luon, age 58, is a diligent mother who strives to work hard to better her standard of living. She is in the business of cultivating rice crops alongside her husband on their farmland in the Prey Chor district. Together, they typically earn an average of $6 per day.

This is Mrs. Luon's second loan from Kiva. She would like to borrow the loan to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family and business as needed. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock like pants, shirts, underwear, blouses and jackets to sell

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Sokny is a 40-year-old mother of five dependent children. Three of them are still in primary school. She has been working on paddy farming and planting cassava for 20 years to make a living while her husband is a homebuilder in the village. She earns more than $5 per day.

This is Sokny's first loan with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, she will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava so as to earn more income and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 62, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Kim and her husband are farmers. Kim is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase groceries to resell when she is available from the rice field. In the future, Kim would like to use her additional income to purchase rice in stock to resell when the price is profitable. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman with eight children. Irene is 50 years old, residing at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Irene own and operate a farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Irene wants to make improvements of her house and to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Due to hardships in life, Magdalena engages herself in the buying and selling of dry goods to supplement her husband's income. She is 40 years old and has two school-age children. They plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. Despite financial difficulties, Magdalena and her husband have the strong determination to work out their plan.

Magdalena aims to improve her small business to increase her income and support the education of their children. She is asking for capital of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of dry goods like shirts, short pants, skirts, blouses, jackets and pants to sell in the public market. She mentions that this loan will help her to work out her plan and make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods like shirts, short pants, skirts, blouses, jackets and pants to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Aged 32, Imelda is a farmer in Tapel. She is married and has three children. She has been farming for five years and currently produces rice to sell in the market. She earns P9,000 every crop season and but finds that this is not enough due to the high cost of school fees, commodities and foods.

She is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase maize seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes these inputs will boost her farming business to produce good income and definitely improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 53, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Chantha and her husband sell groceries. Chantha is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase groceries and cosmetic products to resell. In the future, Chantha would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her fourth loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov, 23, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a noodle vendor in the market. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Srey Pov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a cow to feed in order to produce calves to sell. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a piece of land to run a garage for her husband to fix cars for his clients. Moreover, she would like to build a concrete house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to feed in order to produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Samean's Group

texts.en:
Samean is a 38-year-old mother who is widowed and has three children. Two of the children are still in school while the last one is a grocery seller and sometimes works as a construction worker. She started farming rice as a primary business 18 years ago and she supplements her income as a grocery seller in the village to raise extra income. With her hard work since the previous loan in 2009 from Vision Fund, she earns more than $10 U.S. dollars per day to feed her children and she saves $5 U.S. dollars daily. 

Samean and her group members are applying for another loan. She will use her entire loan to buy a buffalo as labor for her rice farm. This loan will enable her to increase her rice production capacity in order to earn a larger income to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo as labor for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sreysophan

texts.en: Sreysophan, 41, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Sreysophan weaves ties to sell and her husband is a construction foreman. Sreysophan is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase rice to stock and then sell when the price is profitable. In the future, Sreysophan would like to use any additional income to purchase groceries to sell at home. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell when the price is profitable

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 42-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business. Fishing is the main source of income for Andresa's family. Andresa does her best to improve their business and keep her family healthy.

Andresa has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Andresa hopes to have another source of income. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Bum's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Tbaung Khmum district, Bum is 37 years old and has two children who are still in primary school. She started farming rice and planting cassava 18 years ago to earn a living. Sometimes, she works for others for extra income. She earns $3 U.S. dollars per day from her current business and saves  $1 U.S. dollar daily after expenses. 

This is her group’s second loan with VisionFund. Leading a group of three female members, she is requesting a loan to rent a plot of farmland for her cassava business. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland in order to grow more cassava and earn a larger income to make her living better and to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland for her cassava business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is separated and has eight children. She is 51 years old and resides at Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Diosdada plants, harvests, and sells bananas to earn a living and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Diosdada wants to make improvements to her house and to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina, 30, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Rina her husband sell food. Rina is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice. In the future, Rina would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en: This group is made up of six members. The leader is Ros, who is 47 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. Each member will use his/her portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mr. Ros, who works in an agricultural business, will use his loan to purchase merchandise inventory for his wife's store, located in their house. This loan will sustain and enhance this business and enable it to be more successful. He is very grateful for the support to his family and his group members. He hopes that everyone in his group will improve their businesses through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
A villager from an area of the Ponhea Krek district, Yeng is 42 years old and has four children, three of whom are dependents. Two of the three are employed, while the last one is still in school. She has been farming rice for more than 20 years and she also plants cassava to earn a living. 

This is Yeng’s fourth loan with VisionFund. The previous loans since 2008 have helped her earn a better living. From her current business, she is able to earn 15 USD per day. She will use this new loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm and cassava plantation. She hopes to make more rice and increase her cassava crops to earn a larger income. She will use the anticipated profits to extend her farmland and also keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm and cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is married and has one child. She is a hard-working woman who has been in the cultivation of crops for more than ten years and has invested her strength and knowledge. She grows rice and sells it in the market after crop season and earned P8,000 last crop. This is very low income so she patiently works in the field to maintain their business.


Together with her husband, she is working for the family's welfare. They want to earn abundant crops to secure their future. For this reason, she is asking a loan of P10,000 to buy corn seed, fertilizers and pesticides to use in developing their farming business. Hopefully it will produce good income in the next crop season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in developing their farming business.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak, 33, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Vannak sells Cambodian traditional cakes, and her husband is a construction worker. Vannak is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, Vannak would like to use additional income to expand her cake-selling business. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Chhuny's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of four children, Chhuny is a farmer in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district. She has three dependent children working as farmers and students. In addition to farming rice, Chhuny also plants cassava and sometimes works for others to gain extra income. She has been in this business for 18 years. She is able to earn 3 USD per day and saves .75 USD daily. 

This is Chhuny's first group loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crops and earn more income to make a better living and also to keep her children in school. She also hopes to increase the amount of farmland she owns.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sam Im's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Sa Im is a 33-year-old mother of three children. She has one dependent child working for pay at a rubber plantation. She started farming rice and planting cassava on her farmland ten years ago. In addition, she sells cupcakes in the village for extra income. She currently earns more than ten U.S. dollars per day to feed her family. 

There are two members of Sa Im’s group. This is her first loan with VisionFund while her co-member, Teur, has been with VisionFund for one year. She wants to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is 58 years old and married with three children. His two younger children still go to school.

Aurelio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Aurelio primarily grows rice to sell. He works hard to improve his business and support his family. He requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor. Aurelio hopes to soon acquire farming equipment such as a tractor.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Tita is married and has seven adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Tita provides sewing services to the local community. She has been in her business for six years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Tita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and thread. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and thread.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Ms Mai is Trung's mother. Trung is a student at Ha Noi University for Business and Technology, and is studying to become an architect. He has to pay tuition for four years (ending in 2014). Once he graduates, he will work for a construction company and have good salary. To make his dreams come true, he is studying very hard and trying to overcome difficulties. He would like a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael believes that "Success is the fruit of every sacrifice." He is 32 years old, and newly married. His great ambition for his family is to improve their status of living and give them a better life. As a way of gaining income, he engages in buying and selling of dry goods in the public market. He has been in this business for almost 12 years and usually earns a profit of P 10,000 a month, that he uses for their needs and to save for future emergencies. 

He aims to improve his business and increase the products he offers to satisfy his customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, he is requesting for P20,000 to buy additional stock of dry goods like blouses, pants, sweaters, polo shirts, skirts, socks and underwear to sell. He believes that he can improve the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods like blouses, pants, sweaters, polo shirts, skirts, socks and underwear to sell

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
40-year-old Corazon is a married woman with three children aged 14, 8 and 5. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. According to Corazon, they have had this business for 15 years and earn about 9000 PHP per month.

Corazon has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials. She hopes that this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
For almost 12 years of being exposed to the farming business, Julio was able to learn some farming techniques on how to improve his farmland. He is proud that he had been engaged in this kind of business because he is able to earn a living. According to him, farming is primarily the main source of income for his family.

Julio is 58 years old and married. The couple has been blessed with three children. One of them is married already,one is studying and one is working. Julio has been planting rice on his half hectare. Aside from the farming business, he is also engaged in buying and selling carabao within their village. He works hard to sustain the needs of his family, especially for his high school student on whom he is spending his profit. Julio would like to increase his yields this crop season but his income is not enough to buy farm supplies needed in his farming business. With this regard, he is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000. He hopes that through his loan, he can sustain his family needs and let his youngest child finish his degree course.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, 33 and the mother of four children, works hard to generate income for the family by farming rice with her husband. Now that the rainy-season rice has just been harvested, she will start work for the dry season that is arriving soon.

Neang is requesting a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers, rice seeds and lubricating oil to prepare for the new season. In the future, she hopes to own a large farm upon which to grow her crops and raise poultry.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers, rice seeds and lubricating oil.

loans.name: 04.04.6 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and repairs.

Quy is 36 years old and she is married with two children.
.
She is the leader of a six-member group, the 6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. 

Quy lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Quy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Quy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Quy has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main hardship that Quy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quy hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Maryjean

texts.en:
Maryjean is 37 years old, married and blessed with four children. She works in a farming business and has been planting rice for over 10 years. It provides them great economic benefits. She wants to improve their business to receive a good profit. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs of planting.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to gather enough income to lift up her family out of poverty and save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, a 47-year-old widow with two children, lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City where she has a general store that earns her approximately PHP 2,000 each month. A member of PMPC for a month, Gina has requested a loan of PHP7,000  to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glenn. a 31-year-old married father of five children between the ages of 4 and 12, has had a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol for 8 years. Earning about 6500 PHP per month, he works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. Glenn has requested this loan to repair his fishing boat so that he can continue earning income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Ms. Anh is taking out loan for her daughter, Ha. With the hope to be an engineer developing agriculture in rural areas, Ha is enrolled in Ha noi Agricultural University. She will attend for four years, which means that her tuition payments will be complete in 2015. Studying agriculture, she will work for an agricultural department and have a stable job. To make this dream come to true, she is studying very hard and trying to overcome difficulties as much as she can so that she is able to be successful in her studies. She is requesting a loan of 10,206,000 VND to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: With her desire to improve her family's living situation, Rosalie has devoted herself full-time to her pig-raising business for several years. She is 45 years old and is married to Miguel, a farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. They work hard to give their two children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs. She hopes to grow and increase her turnover with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: 01.05.04 Đông Sơn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Năm operates a food stall/restaurant selling eggs. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell.

Năm is 54 years old and she is married with one child.
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 4 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
Năm lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Năm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Năm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Năm has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that Năm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Năm hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to resell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is a single mother of one child. Shiela is 21 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor. She has a piggery business to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs. Shiela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months. In the future, Shiela hopes to have savings for her child's future education.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a married woman who has two children. Mary Jane is 33 years old and resides at Poblacion 3, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mary Jane provides general repair services to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 30,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. Mary Jane has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Mary Jane wants to build a house and support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is an industrious housewife who helps her husband in managing their onion farming business to ensure a good harvest. She is 49 years old and has three children. Despite the hardships of living, they aim to improve their sources of income and support the education of their children. They have been farmers for almost 20 years, and they earn a profit of P25,000 in every harvest season. They use their income for their necessities and to finance their children's education.

They planned to expand their onion plantation to ensure a high yield. But due financial constraints, Norma is asking for an additional P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for onion production. She believes that their patience and hard work will bear a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: 02.01.9 Đông Hải Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do a tailor-made and clothing repairing service.

Minh is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. Minh lives with her 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 09 Đông Hải solidarity group. 

In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women previously. Minh has been involved in this business for 2 years, the main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines to do a tailor-made and clothing repairing service.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok, 53, appears in the photo with her daughter at her own house. She is a widow who is now living with four single children in Takhmao town. Most of the income depends on her four children who work in various positions: a fast food seller, a waiter, a construction worker, and a garment factory worker. Mrs. Sok manages all household things at home so that her children have a comfortable life. 

Sok is taking out this loan from HKL to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to support her children in travelling to their workplaces. She is very grateful for the loan given to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Mrs. Thinh is taking out loan for her daughter,student Nhung. Since she was a child, Nhung has wanted to be a nurse to care for the poor people in her community.
