Currently, she is studying at a medical treatment college. The course lasts three years; she will graduate in 2014. She hopes that she can work for a  local hospital near her house after graduation. Currently, she is studying hard to absorb knowledge. Her goal is to be a professional nurse in two years. Currently, she needs a loan of 14,580,000 VND to pay for tuition fees and to buy books and other supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy books and other supplies.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala, a 52-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol who does her best to support her family, runs a fishing business with her husband. She also buys and sells seaweeds to help augment their income.

Gonzala has requested this loan to purchase paint and adhesives for the fishing boat. She plans to pay her children's school fees with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase paint and adhesives for the fishing boat.

loans.name: 03.11.116.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên  has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Liên is 23 years old and she is married with 2 children, and she lives with her 2 dependents in Thiệu Hóa district. Liên is the group leader of the 03.11.116.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans previously. Liên has been involved in this business for 8 years, the main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old. She is a married woman with three children. She runs a sari-sari store [general store] in Trinidad, Bohol. Gloria sells items like soft drinks, biscuits, and milk. She also retails gasoline. Gloria works hard to earn and help improve her family's living conditions.

Gloria has requested this loan to buy more items such as soft drinks and gasoline to sell. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soft drinks and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Reslie

texts.en:
Reslie is married and has 1 kid. Reslie lives and works in Sto. Thomas. He, like many of his fellow villagers, grows early crops such as corn and rice. He has been farming rice and corn for ten years. At this point he has P 10,000 invested in his business.

Reslie plans to invest the P 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next agricultural season. Reslie hopes to meet the demand of buyers, effectively sell his products, and generate additional revenue from the sale of rice. He plans to further develop his business as it not only allows him to support his family, but also gives him enormous gratification.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Remen

texts.en:
Remen is 43 years old and lives in Purok 5 Molicay, Ozamiz City.  He is married with one infant-aged child. 

Remen has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business.  He has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for his business.

Remen has been a member of PMPC for four months.  In the future, Remen hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en:
Mrs Duoc is taking this loan out for her daughter, student Mai.  Hoping to be an accountant in the future, Mai has gained a place at Hanoi National College for Economy and Technology.  Her tuition lasts for three years and will end in 2014.  Studying this profession, she will eventually work for a commercial company and earn a good salary. 

To make her dream come true, Mai is studying very hard and trying to overcome difficulties as much as she can to gain good results.  She wants to borrow a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees, books and other supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, books and other supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin Mis Occ.  She is married with five adult-age children. 

Susan has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business.  She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock for her business.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for two months.  In the future, Susan hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: 09.4 Nam Ngan Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc has a retail business selling cosmetics. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell.

Ngọc is 47 years old and she is married with 1 child. She lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 9.4 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. 

In 2010, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid 1 loan previously. Ngọc has been involved in this business for 5 years, the main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Mr Thang is taking this loan out for his son, student Cuong.  Cuong is attending Hanoi National College for Economics and Technology.  His tuition lasts for three years and he will graduate in 2014. 

Studying at this college, Cuong hopes to be a mechanic and will work for a mechanical manufacturing factory as an engineer.  Currently, he is coping with difficulties affording his education fees and supplies.  He wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to solve this.

loans.use: to pay education fees and buy some supplies.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs Sem is 49 years old and a single mother of five children, residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.  Three of her children are now working in various positions and help by contributing their income to the whole family.  Sem generates her income by cultivating rice crops on the existing farmland and takes time to manages all things at home to ensure a better living for her children.

At present, she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to build a toilet made of bricks to keep her family in healthy living conditions.  For her future, she wishes to continue supporting her two school-age children until they finish grade twelve.

loans.use: to build a toilet made of bricks.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
Despite problems and difficulties in life, Claribel aims to improve her status of living and become financially stable in the future. She is 42 years old and has no children, for she is separated from her husband due to problems and family conflicts. She lives with her parents and she decided to take care of them, for they now old and incapable. 

She planned to continue managing their farm lots by planting onions to generates income but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for onion production. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to work out her plans and is hoping that she will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is fifty-one years old and is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol.  Gregorio is in the business of raising hogs.  He is able to provide for his family through this business.  Gregorio said all he wants is for his family to be happy and healthy always.

Gregorio plans to use his loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies.  He hopes for his income to increase so he could sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 57 and lives with his family in the community of Sto. Thomas, in the province of Isabela. He lives in an area that produces the most corn and rice in his country, along with rice, beans, fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. 

Loreto is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide to use on the land that he inherited from his parents and continues to cultivate. He will use the profit from his loan to support his children and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Jonnabel

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Jonnabel is a married woman with two children aged eight and six.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Jonnabel sells fresh and dried fish to her community.  She works hard to take care of her children and support her husband in providing for their needs. Jonnabel requested this loan to buy more fish to sell.  She hopes for her business will continue to grow.  Jonnabel also hopes to have enough money to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Mrs Hue is  taking this loan out for her daughter, student Tuyet.  Hoping to be a vet Tuyet has gained a place at Hanoi Agricultural University.  Her tuition will last five years and her graduation will be in 2016.  

She hopes to find a good job in the pet service center in her community.  To obtain this target, she is studying hard to get good results.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to pay for her education fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters education fees.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a mother of four and happily married to Jaime. According to her, she got married when she was 20 years of age. Because she married young, she only finished high school.

Dolores has been running her home-based store for 24 years. She opens her store at 5 o'clock in the morning and she closes it at ten in the evening because she has many customers. She is grateful because through the income generated from her store, she is able sustain her family's needs. She really appreciates her husband's efforts and determination in their agricultural and welding shop businesses to gain extra income for their basic necessities.

Dolores has also been engaged in a pig raising business for 20 years. She is raising one sow and fattening eight pigs. With the businesses she manages, she is able to support her children's education. Nowadays, she is spending her income on her two children who are in college. She hopes to let them finish their degree courses so that they could find good opportunities for their future. She aims to increase her sales to obtain greater profit because she is spending more money on her nine hectares of rice field, pig raising business and education of her two children. With her aim to cover all her expenses, she is asking for additional working capital amounting to P30,000 to be used in buying volumes of merchandise for her home-based store. Through her requested loan she could be able to overcome her struggles in business and most of all she could be generating a bigger income to sustain her family needs and improve her other businesses. She knows that her sacrifices and patience will give her fruitful outcome to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her home-based store

loans.name: Ma. Magna

texts.en:
Ma. Magna runs a fishing business with her husband.  They have had this business for ten years.  According to Ma. Magna, they earn about PHP 12,000 per month.  Ma. Magna works hard to improve their business and take care of her five children.

Ma. Magna has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials.  This will help Ma. Magna's business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 39 years old and chose to be single. She commits herself to caring for her beloved parents and to supporting her younger sisters. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice and onions for sale. Since it is the major source of their income, she plans to expand their onion production to ensure a high yield.

Despite the hardships in farming, she has the strong determination to improve their onion farming business. She is requesting for a loan of P20,000 to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production. She mentioned that through this loan, she will work out her plan and hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed  for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 43 years old. She operates a small business from her home for additional income while the main source of her revenue is generated from farming. She has four children, one of whom is married and lives separately while the other three are still students in local public schools. Mrs. Chea typically earns around $2 per day through farming to support her family.

Mrs. Chea will use her first loan from HKL to pay a fee to rent farmland. Chea hopes that one day she’ll own the farmland she rented from her neighbor as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to pay a fee to rent farmland.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 39 years old, a responsible mother of two children. She is married to Mario, a small-scale farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. Ruby has been engaged in her general store for over one year. As she said, with the income she generates from her general store, she is able to provide their daily meals and continuously send her children in school.

As of now, Ruby is requesting a loan amounting to P15,000 to purchase additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, curls, and other basic kitchen ingredients to sell. She believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and strength of mind.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries such as, canned goods, noodles, curls, and other basic kitchen ingredients to sell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is taking this loan out for her son, student Binh, a student who is attending Hanoi National Agricultural University. His tuition duration lasts four years and he will graduate in 2014. After graduation, he wishes to work for the local department for ground source management as an officer. To make this dream come true, he is studying hard to achieve the best results. Mrs. Huong is asking for a loan of 10,206,000 VND to pay for Binh's school fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru:
Айнагуль  проживает в селе Атбашы на севере Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Айнагуль    с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году. На сегодняшний день,   Айнагуль    в своем хозяйстве имеет 10 голов овец и  1 лошадь. Также, Айнагуль занимает выпечкой овощных пирожков и самс (кыргызские мясные пирожки) и продает их на воскресном скотном рынке, что также служит небольшим доходом в бюджет ее семьи.   
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Айнагуль  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Айнагуль планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Ainagul lives in the village of At-Bashy in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  Similar to many families living in the rural areas, Ainagul and her husband are raising livestock, which they have started in 2009. Currently Ainagul owns 10 sheep and 1 horse. Also, Ainagul bakes vegetable pirozhki (baked stuffed buns) and sams (Kyrgyzstani buns with meat filling) and sells them at a Sunday livestock market which also brings small income into her family's budget. In order to further expand her business, Ainagul  has come to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. Ainagul is planning to invest the income into building a large barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Saraen

texts.en:
Saraen, age 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Her children are employed as a driver and a garment worker. 

Since her husband's current motorbike is very old, Saraen is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi. By doing so, her husband will be able to attract more customers to his transportation service. 

In the future, Saraen would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Batir

texts.ru: Батыр занимается посевом зерновых культур. Кроме того он выращивает бахчевые культуры, также выращивает зимний арбуз. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Батыр хочет посеять пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Batir plants grain crops. In addition, he is growing melon and gourd varieties, as well as winter melon. He is 57 years old. He is married and has 7 children. Batir wants to plant wheat. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho is taking this loan out for her daughter,Mai. With the hope of being a general accountant for a commercial company, Mai is attending Hanoi Industrial College as a second-year student. She will be in school for three years and she will graduate in 2012. To be self-confident in her future job, she is studying hard to achieve good results. 

Mrs. Tho is asking for a loan of 11,664,000 VND to pay for Mai's school fees, books and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees, books and supplies.

loans.name: Suk

texts.en:
Mrs. Suk, age 49, operates a business selling eggplants, which she grows and buys from her suppliers as well. She is able to yield an average of $7 per day. She is not worried about her business because she has her frequent customers who order this type of vegetable for their grocery shop regularly. 

Mrs. Suk is blessed with four children. She has become a very hardworking mother since her husband passed away. 

Mrs. Suk is requesting a loan from HKL to buy a used motorcycle for her household’s and business’ use. This loan will better the way she lives and works. In the future, she intends to expand her farmland and grow additional types of vegetables to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, forty-five, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  She is a rice farmer.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Her children are garment workers.  

Oun has requested a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase farming land in order to grow rice to generate more income.  In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study in higher education.

loans.use: to purchase farming land in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, fifty-one, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  She is an ice cream vendor.  Her husband is a rice farmer.  Her children are garment workers. 

Pov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to carry her ice cream to sell.  In the future, she would like to run a food store at home and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Nyna

texts.en: Nyna, 50, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Four of her children are employed at the garment factory. Nyna is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor-taxi when he is not busy with his farming work. By doing so, her family’s standard of living will be better. In the future, she would like to run a new business of buying rice to sell and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Абдурахим занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. По профессии Абдурахим агроном. В этой области он проработал 20 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп топлива для вспашки земли с помощью трактора.
texts.en:
Abdurahim lives in the region Hamadoni. He is 69 years old and married. He has three children. 

Abdurahim works with growing vegetables. He has been engaged in this activity for 12 years. Abdurahim is an agronomist by profession. He has worked in this area for 20 years. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of fuel for plowing the land with the help of a tractor

loans.use: to buy fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 46 years old with three adult children. Her husband works as a security guard. Anabelle’s first Kiva loan helped her to purchase seed and fertilizer for her farm business. Today, she works cultivating a two-hectare plot of land.  

Anabelle is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase rice and corn seed as well as fertilizer. She hopes to broaden business activities by cultivating more land.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 59-летний фермер, живущий со своей семьей на севере Кыргызстана.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Жумагул начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Жумагула, начатый с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS)бизнес сегодня имеет в оборотном капитале 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также, Жумагул предоставляет услуги комбайнера в период сезонных работ. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жумагул обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a 59-year old farmer, living with his family in northern Kyrgyzstan. In the search of income for his family, Jumagul started his business of fattening and re-selling cattle in 2006. Thanks to Jumagul's persistence and perseverance, from starting with the amount of 6,000 som (KGS), the business currently has a working capital of 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Jumagul also provides harvesting service during the period of seasonal work. 

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Jumagul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep. Jumagul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 31 years old, and she is a married woman with 3 children, aged 7, 3, and 1. Ma. Victoria runs a fishing business with her husband. Her husband goes out to sea to fish and Ma. Victoria sells the catch at the market. Ma. Victoria does her best to take care of her children and to help sustain her family.

Ma. Victoria has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help her business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old and married with three children. She lives at Cabatuan. Her primary source of income is raising hogs. Lilia is busy with her schedule of cleaning and feeding the hogs three times a day. She decided to establish her business to generate income instead of just lazing at home and doing household chores. 

Lilia is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed to nourish her hogs. She currently lacks sufficient funds. Lilia wants to expand her business in the future and hopes this loan will be granted as it is her only chance to improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio is 55 years old and married with three children. He is a loving and hardworking person. Dionicio has grown rice for the past 25 years. At first, he found it difficult to work on the land, because it requires a lot of patience, a strong body, and, of course financial resources. But as he began to farm, he gradually got used to the work and added a plot of land to grow rice.

Dionicio is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and tractor fuel to increase his crop production. He wants to provide a better life for his children and be able to feed them well. He continues to move forward to achieve his dream of having a comfortable life. Dionicio hopes that his loan will result in a more a more productive farm and that he will be able to continue his business and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, and tractor fuel

loans.name: Amarles

texts.en:
Amarles is married with two children and lives in the village of Lapaz, Cabatuan. Amarles is a very responsible mother and wife to her husband. She is engaged in a pig-raising business, primarily pigs for breeding.

Now, Amarles is requesting a loan of P 27,000 to buy feed and vitamins to sustain her pigs. She wishes that someday her business will expand to give her family a good quality life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to sustain her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years of age and married. She lives in the village of Villa Marzo, Cordon. She is living with her only one child because her husband is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker).

Elsa manages her retail store and pig raising business. She has been running her store for three years and she is able to earn about P5,000 monthly. Her income goes to their daily needs and maintenance of her pig raising business. She is currently raising three fattening pigs and piglets. She plans to raise them all and feed them well until they reach their optimum growth so that she could sell them at a greater price. Elsa also wants to increase her sales to obtain greater profit but some of her income goes to her pig raising business so, her capital is no longer sufficient. So, she is asking for financial assistance of the amount of P30,000. She will be using the loan amount in purchasing volumes of merchandise to minimize her fare expenses in going to and from the market and most especially she could have a better time management for her store and child. This would really help her a lot in making her retail store grow. She hopes that she could obtain the loan amount she requested. Though she receives remittance from her husband still she would like to gain her own profit because she is determined to improve their living condition and save some for the education of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, 42 years old, is married and has four children ranging from thirteen to twenty-two years of age. He is a talkative and social man. For the last six years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables along a busy road. He faces the business challenge of insufficient funds. He hopes that by using the requested loan of KES 20,000 he will be able to improve his business by adding stocks of kale, spinach, tomatoes, and peppers. Samuel hopes and dreams of becoming a wholesaler of vegetables in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more kale, spinach, tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Irres

texts.en:
Irres is married with 2 children. She is 25 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Irres plan to earn a living by starting a new business buying and selling rice. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Irres joined PMPC this year (2011). In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son who is a rickshaw driver. With the loan investment, she will buy a new body for his autorickshaw that will allow him to save his precious business asset and provide better quality transport services to his passengers.
Kubra stays at home and does her household duties. She is very active and performs her duties very well.
She is a mother of three sons. All of them are involved in transport business.
Kubra is confident that after the loan investment, her son’s business will be improved and he will be able to increase his income.
Note: “ In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kubra.”

loans.use: To buy an autorickshaw body for transport business

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 30, is married and resides with her husband and a kid in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store from her home. Her husband is a rice farmer. The grocery store is the main source of income for the family, so Chantha needs more funds to expand her business. This is her second loan request; this time, she is asking for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Galmamat

texts.ru: Галмамату 48 лет, женат, является отцом шестерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, 7 лет назад Галмамат начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Галмамата, начатое с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня 12 голов баранов и одну корову и приносит около 2,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также, Галмамат выращивает яблоки, урюк, картошку, что дает прибыль в сезон продаж. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Галмамат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Галмамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Galmamat is 48 years old, married and the father of six children. In the search of income for his family, Galmamat started his business of fattening and re-selling cattle 7 years ago. Thanks to Galmamat's persistence and perseverance, from starting with the amount of 2,000 som (KGS), the farm today counts 12 sheep and one cow and brings in around 2,000 som (KGS) per month. Galmamat also grows apples, apricots and potatoes, which gives a seasonal income.

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Galmamat turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of cattle. Galmamat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 38 years old and married. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Mercy makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Mercy has been in this business for 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month. In 2011, Mercy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and to enable her to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small pub where they sell all kinds of drinks and food. This business is the only source of income to support the family. Therefore, Sokhom is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to expand her business by purchasing more drinks to sell. In the future, she would like to enlarge and expand her pub in order to accommodate a lot of clients and to finish building her house in the back yard.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 40 years old and has been married to Maricel for 15 years. He is a farmer living in the Philippines and he plants and harvests rice to sell. This is his source of income and he has been able to send his children to school with his profits. He has three children currently studying in college and high school. 

Oliver is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve his crop production. In the future, he would like to keep earning profits from his farming business to achieve his desire of a successful way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking mother. She is a widower and has three grown up children. In the absence of her husband, she carries the burden alone in providing for her family's needs. She raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting to sell. With this kind of work, she is able to generate an income just enough for their needs. She pays a laborer too who helps her do farming activities.

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow. She would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma and her husband are farmers who live in Afusing Daga. They have been planting rice to sell since they got married 15 years ago. The income from the business was used for their daily consumption for meals and allowances for her three children. She would like to improve her sales so she is asking for an additional capital to buy farm inputs necessary in ensuring good crops. With the loan of P10,000 she is asking for, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

Someday, through their patience, hard work and unity, they will upgrade their family's poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in farming

loans.name: Lomen

texts.en:
Lomen is 60 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor. She is widowed with six adult children.

To earn a living, Lomen sells clothes. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Lomen has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his stocks of wheat flour, baking flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a simple yet hardworking mother. She has two children who attend school. Unfortunately, she was separated from her spouse due to some personal reason. Her two children were entrusted to her. 

She has been planting rice for almost seven years and she now asks for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pay labor costs of land preparation. She would like to keep producing good harvest for the development of her business and to their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay labor costs in land preparation.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker and a rice farmer. Her husband is a policeman. One of her children is employed at the garment factory. Sarom is requesting a loan of USD 850 to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season. By doing so, she can earn extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a high school graduate living in Linao East together with her parents. She was not able to enter college, therefore she involved herself in the retail business, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is acquiring income to help support their daily needs. She has been in the busines for almost six years.

She would like to avail of a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, eggs and breads to sell. She aims to improve her sales and save funds for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs and breads to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a 38-year-old married woman living in Linao East. Cornelia has two children. Her spouse works as a farmer. 

Cornelia has been in the business of raising pigs to fatten and breed for almost five years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy vitamins, medicines and pig feed.

In the future, Cornelia would like to strengthen her business so that she can acquire more profits in it and someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicines and pig feed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenitas’s goal in life is to lift her family out of poverty. She is 50 years old and blessed with three children. Nenita is married to Lauro, a farmer in their village. Nenita operates a small store in which she sells different products. She has been in this business for two years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. Profits earned are used for allowances and food, and serve as a revolving capital in the business. 

Nenita's business needs additional products to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, and beverages to increase her profits. She is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
Florante is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. He is 32 years old and married. Florante has one child. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Florante provides motorcycle transport services to the people in the village where they live. Each month, he usually earns PHP 7,000. He plans to use this loan of PHP 8,000 to buy side mirrors and new tires. He hopes to improve the service he provides his passengers so that he will keep generating a good income from his business.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors and new tires.

loans.name: Meth

texts.en: Meth, 54, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Meth is a farmer, and her husband sells palm juice. Meth is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. In the future, Meth would like to use additional income to provide sanitation for her family. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 62 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.

To earn a living, Loreta has a business selling of viands (delicacies). She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work.  Loreta has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business. Loreta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 1 year.  In the future, Loreta hopes to sustain her business and have maintenance capital.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth's family lives within the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She has been managing her own variety store for three years. She is married to a farmer and is blessed with three children.

In order to continue improving her store, Elizabeth is asking for a loan PHP 15,000 to be used to buy groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods. Elizabeth believes that the greater the variety of products available in her store, the more sales and income she will bring in. Her requested loan would really be of great help to her, because she can use it to make her business grow. From this, she can sustain her family's needs.

Elizabeth believes firmly in the power of God. Through faith, prayer, and dedication to business everything is possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou, 46, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Chou is a farmer, and her husband is a fisherman. Chou is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a mechanical plow for her husband to transport firewood and charcoal to sell. In the future, Chou would like to use any additional income to run a grocery store in front of her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a mechanical plow to transport firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Neb

texts.en: Neb, 40, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Neb sells snacks and cakes in front of the school. She is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice. In the future, Neb would like to use any additional income to purchase additional stocks to sell when the price is more profitable. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Guardiano

texts.en:
Guardiano is 55 years old. He manages his computer shop in the market. He has been in this business for two years and earns PHP 15,000 a month. He wants to increase his usual income in order to expand his business. For him to achieve his dream, he is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional capital, which he will use to buy computer parts and to expand his business.

Guardiano is looking forward to producing more income through his loan. He knows that he will achieve a good profit because he works tirelessly in his business.

loans.use: to buy computer parts and expand his business.

loans.name: Chanthen

texts.en:
Chanthen (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sophea, is hired to design windows and doors with mirrors. They have been married since 2003 and have one son who is still young and one daughter who attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthen is applying for another loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work on.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work on.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 57, is widowed and resides with a son in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She raises pigs at home. Her son is employed at a garment factory in the city of Phnom Penh. Toch is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more piglets to feed in order to sell them when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Nak, 59, resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Nak sells groceries. She is requesting a loan of US $1000 to repair her house. In the future, Nak would like to use additional income to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is 57 years old and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.

Arcadia has a bread-making business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery. Arcadia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for just one month.  In the future, Arcadia hopes to have savings and to be able to repair their house with the additional income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Kaziwa

texts.en:
Kaziwa is a 20-year-old young, ambitious Iraqi man with a shop that manufactures and supplies high quality PVC casement windows and doors.  

The business has been steadily growing in the past five years, and with numerous construction sites around the city, it is expected to keep growing and successfully generating revenue. 

Kaziwa took a loan from Relief International-Iraq in the amount of $1,200 USD to purchase a special cutting/sawing machine for the factory. Once put in place, he expects to be able to work on more orders and a 10% growth in sales. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a special cutting machine for his window and door factory

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 42 years old and lives in Calunasan, Maria, Siquijor.  She is married with four school-age children.

Valentina sells fresh fish from her husband's catches to earn a living.  She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase a new set of fishing nets. Fishing is the main source of income for her family.

Valentina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Valentina hopes to repair their house using the additional income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of fishing nets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old. She is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Margarita has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She works hard to support her family and to sustain her children's education. She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks and to pay for school fees. Margarita hopes to acquire an additional fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and hooks and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Koemsok

texts.en:
Koemsok (pictured with her granddaughter) and her husband, Phann, live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children--three sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home, and the other four have full-time employment.

Koemsok stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from the business of her husband, who is a construction worker. She is asking for another loan of $600 to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Zuana

texts.en: Zuana is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She has had a business selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for the past three years. Zuana is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and groundnuts [peanuts]. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor Province.  He is married with no children.

Joseph works in the fishing industry and sells his catches in the market. He has been doing this for 9 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase a new set of fishing nets for his fishing business. 

Joseph has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 11 months.  In the future, Joseph hopes to have savings to ensure a good future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of fishing nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat, 41, a loving mother of 3 single children, is a rice farmer with experiences. She has been in this business for ages in Prey Chor district. She has a life partner in her husband who in the same type of business. This couple works very hard on their own farmland both in rainy season and dry season for livelihoods. Together, they typically earn an income of $ 4.00 per day to cover household expenses. At the present, Pat is preparing her soil to grow her dry-season rice, yet she requires some funds to make a good process. Thus, she would like to request a loan from Kiva, through HKL to purchase organic fertilizers to put in her farmland. Her business goal is to increase her output by enlarging her farmland in a next few years.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Raising ducks is the primary source of income for Liza, a certified resident of Villa Salvador, Lapaz. She is 40 years old and is married with two children. As of now, Liza is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase baby ducks to raise for sale. She hopes that she can get the loan she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a sari-sari (variety) store in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a 34-year-old mother of 3 children, aged 11, 8 and 2. Maria's husband is a farmer.

Maria has had her sari-sari store for 6 years. She sells items like eggs, detergent, bath soap, shampoo, and canned goods. Maria works hard to support her family.

Maria has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods. Maria hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, 53, is married with three children. He lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Armando earns his living by planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

In 2004, Armando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Armando wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Marnie is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is the mother of a 2-year-old child. Marnie and her husband run a fishing business in their town. Her husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Marnie sells her husband's catch at the market. Marnie does her best to support her family. She says she hopes to be the best wife and mother to her family.

Marnie has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for their boat. Marnie plans to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for their boat

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She sells cake at the market. Her husband is a construction worker. All of her children are garment workers. Sambath is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and to run as motor taxi when he is free. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support her family. In addition, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 25-year-old married woman with two children not yet in school. She has had a business selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for the past year. Angelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is a busy seamstress and tailor with many orders to meet. As a 47-year-old widow and mother of five children, she takes pride in her work and sets a good example for her children: hard work pays off.

With 25 years of sewing and tailoring, she knows well what her customers need. One need she would like to work on now is to be able to add custom designs to the fabrics she uses, adding a unique touch to the dresses she makes.

Sabiha took a loan from Relief International-Iraq for $1,800 USD to purchase an embroidery machine, giving her the edge of creating unique designs and unique dresses for her unique customers.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and other small items for her sewing business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 36 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with four children. 

Rowena has a food stall business and earns approximately 4600 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 27000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her viand (food) business. 

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her viand business.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon (pictured above) is a widow. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. Thon has been selling porridge and Khmer noodles in her village. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok are considered the national dish of Cambodia that can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. In addition, Thon also raises a cow and grows rice when the rice farming season comes. She is asking for another loan of $800 to assist with her rice farming by buying seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farming.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. He and his wife are both farmers who live in a village. They own and manage a farm, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. Because farming is the major source of their income, they plan to expand their corn plantation to increase their yields and income and support the education of their youngest child who is still in college level. Despite the hardships in farming, they want to pursue the business for they want to educate all their children and make them professionals. 

Due to financial constraints, Renato is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed in corn production. He mentioned that this loan would help him reach his goals and he hopes he will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed in corn production.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon, 54, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are ice vendors. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Currently, she has an old truck which carries ice to sell to the clients and now the truck is broken down. Mon is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay for her truck reparation. By doing so, she can easily carry ice to sell and go further to get more clients. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for her truck repairs.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a construction worker. His wife, Sokhon, is a rice farmer and also sells sugar cane juice when she is free from farming. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have one married daughter.

Thy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives because the house needs repairs in some areas.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is creating problems and needs replacement. By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to finish her orders on time and increase her income.

Razia is the mother of two children. Both of them are young and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Razia couldn’t educate them. She is an experienced lady and has been operating her business for the past many years. She is confident that an investment will help her improve her business.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Rozetha

texts.en: Rozetha, a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school, has operated a business selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan for six years. Now requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes, she will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a responsible father who owns and manages a corn farm in his family's village to generate income for his family. He is 56 years old and has two adult-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 38 years. Being a hard working father, he is educating his two children and making them professionals. He planned to increase his yields and income to satisfy their needs and renovate the family's house. Despite the hardships in farming, he has the patience and determination to increase his production. 

In this regard, he is requesting for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn. He hopes that his patience and sacrifices will bear a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn.

loans.name: Yourn

texts.en: Yourn is widowed and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. One of her children runs a business selling utensils in the market and three more children are employed at the garment factory. Yourn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her son's business by buying more utensils to sell. In the future, she would like to renovate her house and purchase a small truck for carrying utensils to sell.

loans.use: to raise capital for her son's business by buying more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Abdurahmonkhoja

texts.ru: Абдурахмонходжа проживает в городе Исфара. Он женат. Ему 57 лет. У него двое детей. Абдурахмонходжа более 30 лет занимается изготовлением мебели. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en: Abdurahmonkhoja lives in Isfara.  He is a 57-year-old married man with two children.  Abdurahmonkhoja has been engaged in the furniture-making business for over 30 years.  He makes furniture at home.  He is taking out a loan to buy furniture boards.

loans.use: To buy furniture boards

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela, a 50-year-old mother of three children, is the owner of a motorcycle transport service that has been in operation for seven years. Working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family, she is also engaged in a direct selling business in the village for additional income.

Estela plans to start a new business: she wants to raise pigs, but she lack the necessary capital. Therefore, Estela is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase paint for her motorcycle, as well as three piglets and six bags of hog feed. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase paint for her motorcycle, as well as three piglets and six bags of hog feed.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach (pictured above), age 45, is a widow and lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. She has three sons and two daughters; two children are garment workers and other three are in school. 

Mach sells fast food in front of a garment factory. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to rebuild the house where she lives. Because the house structure breaks easily and cannot be repaired, Mach needs to rebuild it.

loans.use: to rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo has been a farmer for almost 33 years, planting and harvesting corn for sale. He is 52 years old and has two adult-age children. He endures the hardships in farming until he educates his two children. He aims to improve their status of living and become financially stable to have a better life. In this regard, he plans to expand his corn plantation to ensure a high production. 

He is requesting for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay the labor costs required in land preparation and planting of corn. He mentioned that the loan will be a great help for him to work out his plan. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor costs required in land preparation and planting of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and fuel wood for resale.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking mother to her five children. All of her children are married and are separately living with their own families. Leonida is 54 years old and widow. According to her, Leonida's husband died in 2005, due to cardiac arrest.

Leonida is selling rice and gasoline within the local community where she lives. She start her business last year and she is able to earn about PHP 3,000 monthly. She aims to increase her profit due to her household expenses. In this regard, she is asking for financial support amount of PHP 25,000. She will be using her loan to buy rice and gasoline for her retail business. She hopes that she can obtain greater profits so that she can save some for her security purposes when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy rice and gasoline for her retail business.

loans.name: Purcila

texts.en:
Puricila is a 31-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years.

Puricila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old.  She is married to Makio and they have three children. Elizabeth has been in the tailoring and clothes-selling business for the last six years, and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES from this. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. She plans to buy nets for selling and fabric for making clothes to sell.

She hopes to use the profits to buy more clothing materials for sale and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy nets and clothing materials for sale.

loans.name: Hongly

texts.en:
Hongly (in the photo) and her husband, Sophal, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003, and have no children yet. 

Hongly stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business; he is a construction worker. Hongly has just finished her house building. She asks for a loan in the amount of $300 to buy a wooden closet. The wooden closet is needed to keep her traditional clothing for attending weddings and other ceremonies -- both important in the Khmer culture -- safe and clean.

loans.use: to buy a wooden closet for keeping her clothes.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a housewife, and she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very efficient woman and performs her duties very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and performs transportation services to his passengers, and also picks and drops off school children.

Azra has given birth to five sons and one daughter. None of them could get an education, due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, while the others stay at home.

Azra has applied for a loan for her husband, who wants to repair his autorickshaw. By doing this, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and increase his income. Azra has a lot of confidence in her husband and is very much sure that an investment will help him make his business more profitable, and her family will be able to live a better financial life in result.

Note: In the photo,"the woman holding a book (called "Asasah Passbook") is Azra.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Lenissa

texts.en:
Lenissa is 33 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with three school-aged children.

To earn a living, Lenissa has a business selling viands (food) in her community.  She earns 5,000 PHP each month from this work.  Lenissa has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business.

Lenissa has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Lenissa would like to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a father who is raising his family in a village. He is 46 and has three school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 28 years. He endures the hardships in farming because he wants to support his family and give them a better life. He aims to have a plentiful harvest to earn more income and support the education of his children.

Due to financial difficulties, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy agricultural supplies needed in corn farming, such as fertilizers and pesticides. He believes that this loan will enable him to expand his corn plantation and hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies needed in corn farming, such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Sreylak

texts.en:
Sreylak (pictured above), age 18, is single. She lives with her sister and father on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sreylak is a chef. She cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. She is applying for her first loan in the mount of $1,200 to repair her home by constructing new walls and replacing the wooden stilts of her house.

loans.use: to repair her home by constructing new walls and replacing the wooden stilts of her house.

loans.name: Aloni

texts.en:
Aloni is 23-year-old married woman with two children who are not in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan, for three years.

Aloni is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Orozbek

texts.en: Orozbek's first Kiva loan helped him to purchase cattle. Today he has a farm with two cows, two sheep, ten goats and one horse, which allows him to earn about 8,000 KGS a month. Now Orozbek plans to broaden his business activities by purchasing pedigreed calves, and for this reason he is applying for his second Kiva loan of 35,000 KGS.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed calves.

loans.name: Naro

texts.en:
Naro, age 35, is a farmer. His wife, Da, age 36, is a traditional singer. They have been married since 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter.  The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Naro is hired to farm and gets paid with fees. He wants to launch his own farming business by himself, but he does not have capital. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buys seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.use: to buys seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to buy a water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.name: Robelito

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Robelito believes that he will improve his family's status of living and give his family a better life. He is 29 years old and has two infant children. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he has a rice farming business to earn and support his family's needs. Every day, he goes to cultivate his farm to ensure a good harvest.

He plans to expand his rice farm to increase his yield, but due to insufficient capital, he is requesting for a loan in the amount of  PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of the rice farm. He believes that he will be able to increase his yield and income through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his rice farm.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 40-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambiom South Sudan for three years.

Monica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bean and rice to resell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean and rice for resale.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 41 years old and lives in Can-asagan, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with three adult children.

To earn a living, Emelda has a business selling viands (food) in the school. She earns about 2000 PHP each month from this work.  Emelda has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Emelda has been a member of Paglaum MUlti Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Emelda hopes to sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 35 years old and married to Lucy. They have two children.

Elijah has been in his current business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He hopes to use these funds to buy more donkeys for water supply transport and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more donkeys for water supply transport.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun is 40 years old and his wife, Samoeun (pictured together), is 49 years old. They have been married since 1990, and have three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and another is still young. The family lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Moeun and his wife are rice farmers. Moeun also does construction work when he has free time from the farm. Moeun is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a cow to raise.  He will be able to get extra income from selling the cow when it is fully grown.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Hounkpa-Tin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUNKPA-TIN est formé de trois personnes qui sont toutes des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Houé Victorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Houé Victorine est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Le couple a six enfants, dont un reste à leur charge. Houé Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant encore à sa charge et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. Houé Victorine a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Houé Victorine mène comme activité la vente de poissons de façon ambulante et de l'huile végétale de façon secondaire. Houé Victorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Houé Victorine sollicite pour la première fois, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUNKPA-TIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
HOUNKPA-TIN Group is made up of three women who are friends. The group's representative, named Houé Victorine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Houé Victorine is married to one Gilbert. The couple has six children, out of whom they still have to support one. Houé Victorine lives together with her husband and the one child she still has to support. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together.

Houé Victorine dropped out of elementary school. For about twenty years, she's been selling fish as a traveling saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells vegetable oil. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

Eager to better satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her income, Houé Victorine is seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetable oil

loans.name: Noudai-Kpon. Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDAI-KPON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Victorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Victorine est âgée de 49 ans et est une veuve. Victorine a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, mais aucun des enfants n'est plus à sa charge. Victorine vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Il y a près de quinze ans que Victorine mène comme activité la vente de mèches à son domicile. Victorine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Victorine sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDAI-KPON.
texts.en:
NOUDAI-KPON Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Victorine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Victorine is 49 years old and a widow. She has five children, out of whom some attend school, but they are no longer under her care. Victorine lives alone and provides for herself on her own.

Almost fifteen years ago, she started selling hair extensions at her home. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to better satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her income, she's seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair extensions

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai (pictured above), age 45, is a garment worker. Her husband, Vut, age 45, is a rice farmer and fisherman. They have been married since 1990, and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One child is a garment worker, another one is a fisherman and the third child attends school. The family is living in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Lai is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and married to Dorcas. They have two children.

Joseph has been in his business for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more seeds and fertilizers for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for sale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 62 years old and married; she has eight children. She is from Tabid, Misamis Occidental. Lilia plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan, for two years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for resale.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan has been baking flatbread for 12 years, stretching out the dough on a special pillow used for throwing the thin bread on the inside wall of the hot, cave-like stone oven. The simple, delicious bread is purchased by families every day, carrying away piles of 10-12 freshly baked goods.

Adnan has been supporting his family, his wife and one child, from this business, but the bakery was recently destroyed and burned down.
 
To be able to quickly return to his business, Adnan took a loan from Relief International-Iraq in the amount of $3,000 USD to help him renovate the flourishing bakery.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his bakery

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Due to hardships of life, Marlon did not pursue his studies in college. He helped his parents in cultivating their farmland until he decided to get married and settle down. He is now 25 years old and  has one infant child. He plans to earn and save more income to build his own house and start a business for his wife to manage.

In this regard, he plans to expand his corn farm to ensure a high production. He is requesting for additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, as well as labor costs, required in planting corn. He believes that through patience and sacrifice, he will be successful in carrying out his plans.

loans.use: to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, as well as labor costs, required in planting corn.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en: Ian, 27 years old, is married and has two children, two and five years old. He describes himself as a patient man. He has sold tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, kale, and onions for the past year. His business is faced with the problem of perishability of the fruits. He will use his loan of KES 15,000 to buy more vegetables: tomatoes, kale, and onions. Ian dreams of one day being a supplier.

loans.use: to buy two crates of tomatoes, three bags of kale and 100 kgs of onions.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
