Linah is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been in the retail shop business for the last two years, from which she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Linah was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her third loan of 25,000 KES, after having repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to buy assorted goods for selling, including bags of flour, rice, and tea leaves.

Linah hopes to use the additional profit created to restock more goods for sale and buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy assorted goods for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Yehime 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEHIME 3 est composé de onze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Virginie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Virginie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Virginie est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un certain Yaovi. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Virginie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants à charge et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Virginie vend depuis quinze ans, du riz et des condiments à son domicile. Virginie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Virginie et les autres membres du groupement YEHIME 3 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: YEHIME 3 is a group composed of 11 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Virginie, is the one raising her hand on the picture. In order to strenghten their business and better meet the needs of their customers, this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ for the first time. Virginie never went to school. She is 50 ans and is married to a man named Yaovi. They have five children. Some of them go to school. Two are still their dependents. Virginie and her husband live with their dependent children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Virginie has been selling rice and condiments from home for 15 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to strengthen their business and better meet the needs of their customers, Virginie and the other members of YEHIME 3 are applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ. Their ambition is to increase their business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and condiments.

loans.name: Shakran's Group

texts.en:
Shakran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a fruit seller. With the loan investment, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs replacement. By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to put more fruit on it and make his business better. 

Shakran is a housewife, stays at home and performs her household duties. She has given birth to a son and two daughters. Her eldest son is not educated, while her daughters are getting their education.

Shakran is confident that an investment will help her husband make more profits from his business. He has a plan to rent a shop in the near future, and Shakran is hopeful that he will be able to fulfill his dream by increasing his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book is Shakran.

loans.use: to buy a new cart for the fruit selling business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old and married to Boniface. They have three children.

Josephine has been in her current business for the past 11 years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000. She hopes to use the funds to buy another car-washing machine and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another car-washing machine.

loans.name: Kyako

texts.en: Kyako is a 26-year-old young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and talkative man. For the past three years, he has been selling slippers, shoes, and belts. In addition, he sells cows and goats. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his business. He hopes that by using the loan of KES 20,000, he will be able to boost the business by adding stock of slippers and shoes. Kyako's hope and dream for the future is to run a shop selling shoes made from bata manufacturing company.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is a tailor specializing in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. However, she has neither her own sewing machine or tailoring shop but instead is hired for fees. Her husband, Vanthan, is a construction worker.

Residing in a Phnom Penh suburb, the couple has been married for seven years and have two daughters, one of whom attends school while the other is yet too young to attend. Navy is now requesting a loan of $1000 to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.use: to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as okra, cabbage, pechay, beans and eggplant.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nida is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. Nida has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase pigs to sell.
  
Nida has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been running a green grocery business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,500.

Beatrice is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy stock of green vegetables and fruits to add to her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. 

Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Married in 2001, Sokny is a weaver, while her husband, Bunthoeun, is construction worker. They also grow rice to earn additional income. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and have one child who is in school. Sokny is requesting a new loan for $400 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

Photo: Sokny and her loom.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEHIGBENAN 4 est composé de seize personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Alice est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Alice mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente de maïs et de l’huile végétale de façon ambulante dans un marché du Bénin. Alice s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Alice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEHIGBENAN 4, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: GBEHIGBENAN 4 is a group composed of 16 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Alice, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Alice is 53 and is married to a man named Nicolas. They have five children, some of whom go to school. One of them is still their dependent. Together they share the various family-related expenses. To do that, Alice has been selling corn and vegetal oil in a market in Benin. She buys those items in a region of Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Alice along with the other members of the GBEHIGBENAN 4 group, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy drums of vegetable oil and bags of corn

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
To earn a living, Benjamin, a 53-year-old father of four grown children, has been growing corn and vegetables to sell for almost 34 years. He usually earns a profit of P19,000 per season from his corn plantation, utilizing his income to provide food, allowances and education for his children, some of whom are now employed.

Despite his success, Benjamin wants to increase his corn yields and so is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay the labor costs involved in planting corn. He is hoping that his patience and hard work will continue to yield good results.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay labor costs involved in planting corn.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married to a welder and has two children. She sells slippers and shoes at Efutu. Esi has been selling footwear for the past seven years. She uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more footwear for sale. With the new profit, Esi hopes to acquire a shop to sell her footwear.

loans.use: purchase more footwear for sale.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 48 лет, имеет одну дочь. Замира работает швеей в  швейном цехе. Девять лет назад, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала свой бизнес в птицеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, начатый с 5,000 сом (KGS) бизнес на сегодняшний день приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи мясных продуктов. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности позволили Замире оплатить контракт на высшее образование для своей дочери.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Zamira is 48 years old and has one daughter.  She works as a seamstress at a sewing factory.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Zamira started her own poultry and animal husbandry business nine years ago.  Thanks to her persistent work, her business, started with 5,000 som (KGS), yields about 8,000 som per month today from sales of meat products.  The earnings from the business allowed Zamira to pay for her daughter's higher education contract.  In order to further grow her business, Zamira requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase bulls.  She plans to invest the profits into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alice Mawia

texts.en: Alice, 39 years old, is married and has five children ranging in age from three and sixteen years. She is a quiet and hardworking woman. For the last five years, she has involved herself in the charcoal selling business. In addition, she also does farming. Her business challenge is the shortage of charcoal for selling. She will use the loan of KES 15,000 to buy more charcoal. In the future, Alice hopes and dreams of being a supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcaol.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is taking this loan out for her daughter, May, a student. May is attending DaiNam University. Her field is banking and financing.

May's studies last four years, until 2014.  She hopes that she will find a good job that is suitable to her knowledge in a bank near her house. To obtain this goal, she is studying hard. Hang has requested a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for May's fees and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for fees and supplies.

loans.name: Cilivia

texts.en:
Cilivia is 25-year-old a married woman with one child who does not attend school.  She has been operating a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan, for one year.

Cilivia is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans and onions. If she makes any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to save the money in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba cooks banku (a Ghanian staple) for sale. She serves the banku with fish and vegetable sauce at Efutu. She has done this for five years now.  Aba is married with five children. She uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bulk maize and fish for her banku business.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and fish for her banku business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  extracts palm oil and palm kennel oil for sale at Efutu. Ekua is married to a chain saw operator and has 4 children. Ekua has been into this business for 8 years. She uses her income to assists the husband in the upkeep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase palm fruiit and palm kennel for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel for the oil.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married to a man named Glenn.  Together they have three children. To generate an income, the couple has established a  retail clothing business located at Cabagan Public Market, a 30 minute ride from her house.

Helen works every day from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.   She is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy shirts, blouses, pants and dresses to sell.  In the future, Helen wants to expand her business and build a small house near her stall.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants and dresses

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a hardworking man. Though he has a disablity, he still generates an income for the sustenance of his family. He is married and has one child. His wife helps him transplant rice seedlings on his two hectare rice field, and he also hires laborers to do some farming activities.

Felipe is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy three bags of rice seed, six bags of fertilizer, and pesticides.  Someday, he hopes to achieve financial stability so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Arbana

texts.en: Beside Araba are drums of palm oil she distribute to retails to sell. She also sells kenkey (fried corn dough) at Efutu. Araba has been into this business for the past 15 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 7  dependents. Araba uses her income to assits the husband to feed their family. Because she sells the oil in large quantiites, she willl need this loan to get more oil from the extrators to sell. With the new profit, Araba will purchase machines to extract the oil herself.

loans.use: buy more oil  from the  oil extractors.

loans.name: Naut Ainy

texts.en:
Naut Ainy and her husband have been married since 1990 and have three sons and four daughters.  Her husband is a fisherman who sells fish he catches at the village market. She helps her husband with his work, but sometimes is unable to because her health is not good.

Naut Ainy has borrowed money before.  She is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a new motor for her husband's boat because the one he uses now is old and does no work well. 

She and her family live in a village about twenty kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh. Naut Ainy’s family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for a boat

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a married woman having two children. Arlene is 43-years-old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Arlene owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 27 years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000.00 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Arlene wants to build a house and to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 37 years old and is married with two children. He is a rice farmer who earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season, in April and November. 

Ricardo is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming, which he has been doing for 10 years. 

In the future, Ricardo hopes to further enhance his crop production so that he can earn enough funds for the college education of his children.  He would also like to be able to save some money to pay for any unexpected family expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Eunice Mawia

texts.en: Eunice, 22-years-old, is a single young woman. She has no children. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She does tailoring and sells trousers, shirts, t-shirts, etc., along a busy road. She has been involved in this activity for one year. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes materials. In the future, Eunice hopes and dreams to run a tailoring school.

loans.use: to buy clothes materials.

loans.name: Savarn

texts.en:
Savarn, age 51, lives in a suburb of the city of Phnom Penh. She is a widow with four sons and one daughter. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a security guard and the other two are garment workers.

Savarn is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to use for work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to use for work

loans.name: Gbehigbenan 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEHIGBENAN 1 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Baoun Odette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Baoun Odette est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Baoun Odette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Baoun Odette est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges, Baoun Odette vend depuis une trentaine d’années environs des condiments et des vivres dans une boutique située à son domicile. Baoun Odette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Baoun Odette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEHIGBENAN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GBEHIGBENAN 1 is a group composed of 11 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Baoun Odette, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Baoun Odette is 56 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. Baoun Odette is married to a man named Lucien. They have two children, one of whom goes to school. They both take care of the family financially. To contribute to the various expenses, Baoun Odette has been selling food and condiments for about thirty years in a little shop located in her house. Baoun Odette buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Baoun Odette, along with the other members of the GBEHIGBENAN 1 group, is applying for a third loan from ALIDÉ. The first two loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy food and condiments.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie farms rice to earn a living for himself and his family. He is 36 years old and has two school-aged children. Jessie endures the hardships of farming because he wants to support the education of his children. He plans to expand his rice acreage in order to increase production. 

Jessie is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the wages of farm laborers. He hopes he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Emily Makokha

texts.en: Emily is 46-years-old, married and has five children ranging from six to twenty years. She describes herself as an idealistic woman. She runs a grocery store where she has sold cabbages, onions, tomatoes, carrots, oranges and mangoes for the last four years. Her business worry is the high cost of goods sold when buying them. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy tomatoes, onions and mangoes. Emily hopes in the future to have had expanded her grocery store into wholesale and venture into providing services on rental houses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and mangoes.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 33 years old, and blessed with two school-aged children. To make living, she sells clothes from a stall at the market. She earns 300 Philippine pesos a day if it is a market day. But on a regular day she isn’t able to meet her usual profit. 

Shirley is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional goods to sell such as t-shirts, shorts, pants and dresses. She hopes these goods will attract more customers and result in higher sales. She wants her business to further improve so that she can continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as t-shirts, shorts, pants and dresses

loans.name: Sineng

texts.en:
Sieng, age 29, is a garment worker. Her husband, Von, age 30, is a construction worker. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh and have one young son. 

Sineng is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting.  

Photo: Sineng, her husband, and their son.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is 31-year-old a married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling food from a stall in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Madelin is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava and onions. If she is able to make any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to use the money to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and onion

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun is 48 years old and her husband, By, is 50 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment, two attend school and the other two assist their parent in their farming business.    

Thoeun and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to assist in her farming business by buying seed and building shelter to shade her vegetable from the sunlight.

loans.use: to buy seed and build shelter to shade her vegetable from sunlight.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio has been raising crops since he got married 15 years ago. He is an experienced farmer but according to him, he wantd to improve his farming practices so that he can increase his earnings. He has two children that attend elementary school.

As of now, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy three bags of rice seeds and five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be used in farming. 

In the future, Artemio would like to further develop the business and make his family live progressively.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be  used in farming.

loans.name: Sâl

texts.en:
Sâl is a 37-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district. She is a mother of 4 children and works as a farmer cultivating rice crops within the two seasons of the year. She works alongside her husband, earning a profit of $1.50 per day. One of her daughters is working on a sewing staff in Phnom Penh to contribute a part of her salary to raise the family as well. 

This time, for her first loan, Sâl will use the loan to purchase a used motorcycle to meet the need of her family. It will provide a good transportation for the whole family wherever they wish to go and help cut down some of the expenses from transportation fees.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin and his wife, Phally (pictured together), are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower and cucumber on their farmland in the village where they live. Sin is asking for his first loan of $500 to buy pipes and a water pumping machine to spray his farm.  

The couple has been married since 1987 and have three sons and one daughter. Three of their children attend school and the other one is still young. They are living in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.name: Mbiti Nguli

texts.en: Mbiti 43-years-old, is married and has four children ranging from nine months to fifteen-years-old. He is a quiet and social man. Clothes selling has been his activity for the last five years. He has one employee. His business is faced with the challenge of insufficient funds. He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes as he anticipates that the purchasing power will increase from the customers during the December holiday. In the future, Mbiti hopes and dreams to run at least two boutique shops in his home area town.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Marvin did not pursue his studies in college because his parents could not afford to finance his schooling. Despite this, he did not lose hope. He planned to work hard and save more income and continue his studies later. He is now 21 years old and plans to expand his corn plantation to ensure a high production.

To work out his plan, Marvin is requesting for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor costs required in corn production. He hopes that this loan will help a lot in the improvement of his business and is hoping that he will be having a fruitful harvest and earn income in order for him to continue his studies in college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor costs required in corn production.

loans.name: Chiybyl

texts.ru:
Чийбылу 55 лет, женат, воспитал четверых детей. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Чийбыл начал свой бизнес в торговле продуктами и товарами повседневного спроса. Магазин Чийбыла известен тем, что при хорошем качестве товара, он реализует продукты по низкой цене, что важно для людей с небольшим достатком.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду, Чийбыл сумел развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом   около 10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чийбыл обратился  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Чийбыл планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Chiybyl is 55 years old, married and raised four children.  In search of an income source for his family, he started his own business of selling products and goods of daily demand in 2009.  Chiybyl's store is famous for the good quality of products.  He sells products at low prices, which is important to people with small incomes.  Thanks to his persistence and hard work, Chiybyl was able to grow his business to yield a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop his business, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand his product selection.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into expanding his retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn is a farmer. She grows papayas, bananas, and tomatoes on her farmland in the village where she lives and sells her products to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. Yorn is a widow mother with three sons and three daughters.

Yorn requested a Kiva loan few times already. She hopes to continue her farming business because it’s a business she has been in for more than 30 years. That’s why she applied for another loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Veronica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 65-years-old and married to Stephen. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling milk for the past two years with a monthly income of Kes 4,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Tabitha will use the loan to buy more milk for selling. With the anticipated profit from the business she will venture into the green grocer business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more milk for selling.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42-years-old, single. 

To make a living, Imelda is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, etc. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Imelda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2011, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Manibessibé

texts.fr:
Manibessibe est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un transitaire. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 4 ans et le dernier a 1 ans.
Manibessibe travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des pagnes, des mèches des casseroles et du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Manibessibe a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois, des mèches, des pagnes et des casseroles. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Manibessibe voudrait développer son activité en investissant dans d’autres activités. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Manibessibé is a 26-year-old woman. She is married to a freight broker. She has 2 children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 4 and the second one is 1.
Manibessibé has been working as a retailer since 2009. From home, she sells pagnes (traditional fabrics), hair extensions, pots, and charcoal to all kinds of customers. She buys those items in Lomé. She works alone. For the moment, her main problem is competition.
Manibessibé is applying for this first loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal, hair extensions, pagnes, and pots. She wants to reinvest in this business.
In the coming years, Manibessibé would like to expand her business by investing in other activites. With the profits, she intends on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, pots, traditional fabrics, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy refill cards for prepaid phones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more hardware to resell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is  taking this loan out for her daiughter Oanh, a student. Oanh is a first year student at Domestic Affair University. She will graduate in 2014. She hopes to find a job as a manpower managing officer in a company. Therefore, she is studying hard to get good results. Oanh is in need of a loan of 10,935,000 Vietnam dong to pay for her tuition fees, book, and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 35 years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with three children, ages 8, 6, and 1. He has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Raphael will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
"If there is patience, there is progress" is a guiding principle of Nestor, 28 years old and newly married. He planned to become financially stable to support his family and give them a better life. He has owned and managed a corn farming business for almost five years and usually earns a profit of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. He aimed to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields. 

Due to financial constraints, he is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor costs required in planting corn. He believes that the loan will help a lot to work out his plan and is hoping that he will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor cost required in planting corn.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin, 29-year-old single businessman, has been operating a motorcycle transport service for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000. Introduced to KADET by an existing customer, he is applying for his first loan to buy a motorcycle. With the anticipated profit from the business he will service the motorbike. Benjamin's dream is to buy a taxi to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 55 years old. She is a single mother with one adult child. Agnes has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her child.

Agnes is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Agnes will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 72 years old, he is married to Esther. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the bee-keeping business for the past year, with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Barnard will use the loan to buy beehives. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, bags and cartons of soap

loans.name: Granush

texts.ru:
Грануш замужем. У нее с мужем трое детей. Она занимается выращиванием ранних овощей (помидоров и редиса) в теплицах. Ферма большая, но на огороде у нее порядок. Грануш имеет 8 больших построенных теплиц. Она садит 12 тыс помидор и высокие и низкие. Участок расположен на берегу водохранилища, что откуда она берет воду для полива. Грануш занимается этим бизнесом уже 17 лет и планирует развиваться дальше.

В этом году Грануш со своим мужем приобрели участок земли. Они затратили много средств и нуждаются в кредите. Грануш просит предоставить 20,000 гривен, чтобы закупить семена для посадки, уголь для отопления и удобрения.

(Примечание: на фотографии Грануш вместе со своим мужем, Александром)
texts.en: Granush is married, and she and her husband have three children.  She is involved in growing early vegetables (tomatoes and radishes) in greenhouses.  Her farm is large, but in good order.  Granush has eight large, built greenhouses.  She plants 12 thousand tall and short tomato plants.  Her land is located on a shore of a water reservoir, from where she gets water for irrigation.  Granush has been involved in this business for 17 years and plans to grow further.  This year, Granush and her husband purchased a plot of land.  She spent a lot of money and need a loan.  Granush is requesting 20,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds for sowing, coal for heating and fertilizers.  (Note: the photograph shows Granush together with her husband, Alexander)

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing, coal for heating and fertilizers

loans.name: Jovelon

texts.en:
Jovelon is a father who has the strong determination to become successful someday. He is 32 years old and has three school-age children. He has owned and managed a corn farming business for almost 6 years and usually earns a profits of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. He utilized his income for the food and allowances of his children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he needs to earn more income to satisfy their basic necessities.

In this regard, Jovelon planned to increase his corn production to earn a higher income. He is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in corn production. He believes that he will increase his production and income as he continued to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in corn production

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 50-year-old widower with three children aged 10, 7 and 5 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past 8 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Kennedy will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will help to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to keep bees, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Khabibilla

texts.ru: Хабибилле 49 лет, живет со своей семьей в селе Кокташ, что на юге Кыргызстана.  Хабибилла  - счастливый отец трех дочерей и 8-летнего сына.  Хабибилла работает лаборантом в местной школе, но  к сожалению зарплата не позволяет покрыть расходы семьи, поэтому в начале 2000 года Хабибилла решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Хабибиллы, начатое с суммы в 3,500 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Торговлю он осуществляет на воскресных скотных рынках. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Хабибилла обратился в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Хабибилла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность оплатить учебу для своих детей.
texts.en: Khabibilla is 49 years old and lives with his family in the Kok-Tash village in southern Kyrgyzstan.  He is a happy father of three daughters and an 8 year-old son.  Khabibilla works as a lab technician at a local school, but, unfortunately, his salary does not allow him to cover family's expenses.  This is why he decided to start his own animal husbandry business at the beginning of the year in 2000.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, Khabibilla's business, started with a sum of 3,500 som (KGS), yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month today from sales of dairy and meat products.  He sells his products on weekend livestock markets.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Khabibilla requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into a further increase of domestic livestock quantities in order to have an opportunity to pay for his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells second-hand clothing in Efutu. She is married to a police officer and has five children. Araba has been selling second-hand clothing for the past seven years now. She assists her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for sale.  With her new profits, Araba will acquire a shop to sell the clothing.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un Chauffeur. Elle a 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des chaussures pour tous clients à domicile et au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’as pas de difficultés.
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait diversifier ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en: Akoua is a 44 year old woman.  She is married to a chauffeur.  She has 5 children who all attend school.  The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  Akoua has worked as a retailer since 2001.  She sells shoes for all kinds of customers from her home and at the market.  She buys the products in Lome. She works alone. Right now, she does not have any problems.  Akoua is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes.  She will reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Akoua would like to diversify her merchandise.  She says that with the profits she plans to ensure the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a widow and has nine dependents. Aba cooks kenkey for sale at Efutu. She is mixing the dough she uses in preparing the kenkey.  As a single parent, Aba is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying the school of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for kenkey preparation. With her new profits, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for kenkey preparation.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with four children. Myrna is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Myrna is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her piglets. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of feed and vitamins for her piglets.

loans.name: Zia's Group

texts.en:
Zia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s carpet-weaving business. Carpet weaving is a well known industry in the country and Zia’s husband is an expert in his work. He supplies carpets to different carpet selling shops in the market and earns reasonably good profits.

With the loan investment, he will buy thread and other raw material used in making carpets of better quality. Zia has full confidence in her husband that he will make good use of the money and successfully be able to improve his business.

Zia is a housewife and performs household duties by staying at home. She has given birth to 4 daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter is 20 years old and does decorative embroidery for her neighboring clients.

Zia is confident about her husband’s business success as a result of an investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah passbook is Zia.

loans.use: to buy thread and other raw material for a carpet-weaving business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 55 years old and married to Ann. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Bernard will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Somié

texts.fr:
Somié est une femme âgée de31 ans. Elle est mariée. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.
Somié travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Somié a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Somié voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Somié is a 31 year old woman. She is married. She does not have any children.  Somié has worked as a retailer since 2004.  She sells cereals for all types of customers at her home.  She buys the products in Lome.  She works alone.  Right now, she does not have any problems.  Somié is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals.  She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Somié would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is widowed with three children.  Susan is 46 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.

Susan is engaged in the growing of pigs in her backyard to earn a living.  She has been doing this for one year.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase feed and medicine for her pig-raising business.

Susan has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Susan hopes to have savings deposit for better education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 60 years old married to Esther. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Titus will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 55 years and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.  Patricia has a Sari Sari Store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general Store.

Patricia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Patricia hopes to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her General Store.

loans.name: Clemencio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 34 anos é pai de um filho, vive na casa dos pais com sua esposa, não responsabiliza se por niguem.
Proprietario de um estabelecimento onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade ( sardinhas, açucar, farinha de milho) tem tido de lucro um valor de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas diaspesas da casa, conta com ajuda de um empregado que aufere 1.500.00mt mensalmente. Este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. Os anteriores todos de 20.000.00mt foram para a habitação. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder aoutros creditos.
Pretende futuramnte comprar uma camioneta que lhe possa facilitar nos seus trabalhos diarios.
texts.en:
Clemencio was born in the district of Namaacha. He is 34 years old and has one son. He and his wife live in his parents' house, and he is not financially responsible for anyone else.
He owns a business where he sells staple goods (sardines, sugar, corn flour). It has earned profits of 5,000 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He has one employee, whom he pays 1,500 meticals a month. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His previous loans, all for 20,000 meticals) were used to build his house. He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan early and request more loans.
In future he intends to purchase a truck that will make his day-to-day work easier.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for his shop.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza tem 46 anos de idade,  é casada vive na casa própria com sua familia não responsabiliza se por ninguem. 
É  negociante a mais de 14 anos e conta com ajuda do marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul, vende roupas usadas no Mercado Informal nas Quertas e Sabados no periodo das 5h as 12h. Tem um rendimento mensal de 3.500.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. 
Este é seu terceiro empréstimo na  Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria ( compra e venda de roupa usada), os anteriores de 3.500.00 e 5.000.00mt foram para o comércio.
futuramente pretende adquirir mais empréstimos para a reabilitação da sua resindêcia.
texts.en:
Elisabete was born in the province of Gaza. She is 46 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her family, and doesn't take care of anyone else.
She has had a business for more than 14 years. Her husband, who works in South Africa, also contributes to the household. She sells used clothing at the Informal Market on Fridays and Saturdays from 5 a.m. to noon. She earns about 3,500 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses and for building her home.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 8,000 meticals, which she will use to increase the quantity of merchandise (used clothing) she carries. She used the previous loans, in the amounts of 3,500 and 5,000 meticals, for her business.
In the future she'd like to request more loans to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 58 years old married to Matene. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Margaret will use the loan to buy animal feeds and a beehive. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to keep bees in large scale and be a honey distributor.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and a beehive.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business, a food stall, in Yambio, South Sudan for six years.

Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans & rice for sale.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her eldest son is a fruit seller and the second one is studying. Her 2 remaining children are very young and are not of school-going age yet.

Her husband sells fruit and operates his business from a nearby shop. He never compromises on quality and always provides fresh quality fruits to his customers at reasonable rates.

Nusrat is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very fond of sewing and works with great dedication.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity for selling.

He has been operating his business for many years and Nusrat is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for a fruit selling business

loans.name: Naftal

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 29 anos, tem  10ª classe vive na casa própria é casado. Não tem filhos e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais.
E trabalhador da saúde, com a categoria de motorista a 8 anos,  Aufere mensalmente um valor que aplica nas dispeas da casa e da sua obra que por questões da subida elevada de preços ainda esta em construção. Este é seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende concluir as minimas partes da sua casa. Os anteriores de 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 35.000.00mt foram pra habitação 
Pretende futuramente, mobiliar a sua casa e ser um grande empresario.
texts.en:
Naftal was born in the city of Maputo. He is 29 years old and finished the tenth grade. He lives in his own home and is married. He doesn't have children, and he supports his parents financially.
He's has worked in the healthcare industry as a driver for 8 years. He uses his monthly wages to cover household expenses and to continue building his house, which because of rising prices is still unfinished. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to finish the basic parts of his house. His previous loans (in the amounts of 10,000, 10,000, and 35,000 meticals) were also used for the construction.
In the future, he would like to furnish the house and become an important businessman.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
Maternidad is a widow with 8 children. Maternidad is 74 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maternidad is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers. 

Maternidad has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 39 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children; 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his small business, where he sells maize, beans, and flour. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his children. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big market. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE est composé de treize personnes qui habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Inès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Inès est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Ernest. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Inès a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Inès fait de la transformation de la farine de manioc qu'elle vend depuis une dizaine d'année dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Inès vend de l'huile de palme. Inès s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Inès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE , un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: AYIDOTE is a group composed of 13 people who live in the same village. They all have an income-generating activity. This is the second time that this group requests financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Inès, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Inès is 31 and is married to a man named Ernest. They have three children. Some of them go to school. One is still their dependent. Inès quit school at the primary level. To support her family, Inès processes cassava, which she has been selling in her area for about 10 years. Inès also sells palm oil on the side. She buys the necessary produces in a city in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Inès, along with the other members of the AYIDOTE group, is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava to be processed

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and married to Lillian. They are blessed with three children aged 15, 12 and 6 years respectively.  He has been in the saw mill business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy trees for timber and a saw. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to venture into tea farming and to build a premise for his saw mill business.

loans.use: To buy trees for timber and a saw.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 38 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has six children; 3 of them are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Safina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Safina to generate greater profits and expand her business. Safina hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big shop.

Safina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 28 years old, married to Hellen. They have two children.

He has been in the business for the last 4 years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. He is requesting his first loan of KES 11,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy pieces of metal on a large scale and to own a fully equipped workshop.

loans.use: To purchase metal materials i.e, cast iron, bronze, aluminum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Nuruypa

texts.en: Her first Kiva loan has helped Nuruypa to purchase cattle. Today she has a farm with four milk cows, six sheep and one bull, which allow earnings of about 5,000 KGS a month. Now Nuruypa plans to broaden the number of cattle and for this reason, she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 60,000 KGS for purchase three bull-calves. Her dream is to see her children be educated and intelligent people and now she is doing her best to save money for their education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse  est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Elle vend des produits ménagers tels que le savon, des ustensiles et des tissus.Elle entretient sa famille avec les produits de son commerce.Elle supporte surtout les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et ceux de leurs nourriture. Pour renforcer son activité et augmenter ainsi ses revenus, elle sollicite un prêt de 75000f pour l'achat de 10 caisses de savon et 3 rouleaux de tissus. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman; a mother of 4 children who all go to school. She sells household products such as soap, utensils, and fabrics. She supports her family with the income generated by this business. She mainly pays for food for her children as well as their school fees. To strengthen her business and increase her income, she is applying for a 75000f loan in order to buy 10 boxes of soap and 3 rolls of fabric. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of soap and 3 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver by profession. With the loan investment, he will buy a new autorickshaw which he will supply on a rental basis to supplement his income.

He has been in the transport business for the past many years and Shazia is hopeful that by purchasing a new autorickshaw, her husband will be able to increase his income which will allow her family to live a better financial life.

Shazia is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. Two of her children are studying while the remaining two are not of school-going age yet.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: to buy a new autorickshaw for a transport business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda runs a sari-sari store -- a small retail shop -- where she sells snack foods, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages. She is 41 years old, married and has one child. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker in Saipan.

Imelda wishes to expand the variety products she offers to customers at her shop. Her goal is to earn a higher income so she is better able to sustain her family's basic needs. According to her, if her business becomes stable and profitable, her husband may no longer have to work abroad. She always prays that someday she and her child will live with her husband.

Imelda is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional items to sell such as noodles, bread, beans and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy items such as noodles, bread, beans and canned goods for resale at a small retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is 26-year-old married woman with no children.  She has been running a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for five months.

Jenty is requesting this loan through Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice.  If she is able to make any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans save money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish, animal feed, and home products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and expand her business. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont à l'école primaire.Elle vend des crèmes glacées et des produits agricoles comme le mil, l'arachide et le haricot.Son activité génère des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Toutefois, les frais de scolarité des enfants sont essentiellement à sa charge. Pour renforcer sa capacité de production, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f auprès de UIMCEC afin d'acheter un réfrigérateur neuf.Son ambition est d'installer une cantine au marché central de s localité.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman, who is mother to three children, two of whom are at primary school. She sells ice-creams and agricultural products such as millett, groundnut and beans. Her business generates sufficient income to look after herself and help out her husband with the family expenses. However, she is essentially responsable for the children's schooling costs. In order to strengthen her production capacity, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from UIMCEC so that she can buy a new fridge. Her ambition is to have a stall in her town's central market.

loans.use: to buy a new refridgerator

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She has a sari-sari store (a smal retail shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for five years.

Maria has requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages as inventory for her shop.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 30-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.   She has operated a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.

Lucy is requesting this loan through Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil.  If she is able to realize any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to use it to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children.
 
Miguelita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Miguelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Miguelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yana

texts.ru:
Яна замужем. У нее есть одна дочь. Яна торгует эксклюзивным женским бельем, халатами, пижамами, купальниками и пр. товаром в своем небольшом магазине.  Она зинимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. Отлично умеет выбирать товар и предлагать его покупателям.  

Магазин Яны, он находиться в прохожем месте, на углу многоэтажного дома. Его украшают, красивые стеклянные полки и эффектная вывеска на улице, схожая с той что на фото.

Яна всегда внимательно следит за пополнением ассортимента, часто привозит что-то совсем новое и необычное.  Яна просит предоставить ей кредит в 18,000 гривен для закупки нижнего белья высокого качества украинского производства, а также тапочек.
texts.en: Yana is married and has one daughter.  Yana sells exclusive women's undergarments, robes, pajamas, swimming suits and the like goods in her small store.  She has been involved in this business for seven years.  She has an excellent ability to select merchandise and offer it to her customers.  Yana's store is in a location with good foot traffic, at the corner of a high-rise building.  Beautiful glass shelves and an effective street sign, similar to one on the photograph, distinguish the store.  Yana always pays attention to expanding her merchandise selection and often brings in something very new and unique.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 18,000 hryvnia to purchase high-quality undergarments, made in Ukraine, and also slippers.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments and slippers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years olds and married to Naomi. They are blessed with five children. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build his own house on his new land.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 46-years-old and lives in the town of Namutuba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years Sam has been working hard to manage his small business which sells maize and beans. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale, and will help Sam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big business. 

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mahouna Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUNA est formé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Albertine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Albertine est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Grégoire. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Albertine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Albertine vend des liqueurs et des boissons sucrées dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Albertine vend des beignets de manioc et de blé à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Albertine achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Albertine et les autres membres du groupement MAHOUNA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Mahouna group is made up of 15 people who live in the same village and who all have income-generating activities. The representative of this group, whose name is Albertine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Abertine is 33 years old and married to a man called Grégoire. The couple has three children, all dependents, some of whom are at school. Albertine did not attend school and she now sells liqueurs and sugary drinks in her area. At the same time she sells cassava and wheat fritters from home. These activities allow her, together with her husband, to cover the various family expenses. Abertine buys her products in a village in Benin. This is the first time that she and the other members of the Mahouna group have requested a loan from Alidé. This loan will enable them to strengthen their activities and increase their turnover, so that they can respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cartons of liqueurs and wheat flour

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 45 years old and a nurse by profession. She has a full time job.

Besides her job, she also performs her household tasks very well. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother who also lives with her and operates an animal selling and livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy goats and sheep and will sell at a profit after raising them. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Naseem is confident that her brother will make good use of the loan money and will gain maximum profits by utilizing it in a professional manner.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 39-years-old and married to Jedidah. They are blessed with two children aged 13 and 11 years respectively. He has been selling fruits for the past six years with a monthly income of Kes  10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Alexander will use the loan to buy fruits to add to his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a hand cart. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup truck which will help him transport his fruits to different markets.

loans.use: to buy fruits to add to his business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.

Martha is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Namutuba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Amina has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for resale, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Julieta helps her husband manage their corn farming business to ensure a high production. She is now 54 years old and has four adult-age children. Through their patience and hard work, they educated their children and most of them are now married and have their own family. Despite this, Julieta aims to continue managing their business to earn and save for their basic necessities and for future emergencies.

To work out her plan, Julieta is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for her corn farming business. Despite the hardship in farming, they believe that they can increase their yields through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 8 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il est menuisier métallique et tient un atelier dans sa localité.Il s'active aussi dans le commerce de fer qu'il récupère dans des dépôts ou achète auprès de particuliers.Il revend sa marchandises à des sociétés installées dans la capitale.Il a démarré cette activité depuis 2000 et parvient à entretenir sa famille avec les bénéfices qu'il acquiert.Aujourd'hui , il envisage de construire une quincaillerie dans sa localité qui n'en compte qu'une seule malgré la forte demande. Ainsi, pour augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter du fer.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man and father to eight children, who are all at school. He is a metalworker and has a workshop in his town. He also trades in iron which he picks up in warehouses or buys from private individuals. He sells his goods to companies in the capital. He began this business in 2000 and manages to look after his family with the profits he makes. Today he is planning to set up an ironmongery in his town, where there is only one such store, despite strong demand. Thus, in order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs so that he can buy iron.

loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 30 years of age, single and has one child who she is sending to school. Glenda is engaged in a retailing business selling powdered soap, perfumes and lotions. She has been in this business for almost eight years.
