Glenda’s way to sell her products is walking around their village, offering the products to the people in their village. Even rain or shine, Glenda continues to sell because it is her source of income to provide the needs of her child.

Glenda wants to gain higher income. She plans to build a sari-sari store business (variety) to have an additional source of income. With the connection of her plan, Glenda is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional perfumes and lotions and build a sari-sari store business. She hopes to take the loan and earn a higher income from her additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase additional perfumes and lotions and to build a sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en:
Naomie is 30-years-old and lives in Bardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children ages 3 and 15 years respectively. They all live at home with their parents and go to school. 

For the past two years now Naomie has been operating a grocery shop where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap rice and many items. Most interestingly she has many customers since her business is in a very good location. Naomie is requesting a loan to purchase more toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap rice and many items for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children on how to manager the business.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and many items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of  goods for sale.

loans.name: Bitty

texts.en:
Bitty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Bitty has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bitty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bitty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. One of the children is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Hawa.  She is married to a businessman and has 4 children, aged 21, 19, 17 and 15 years. In 2006, Hawa established her pure drinking water and drinks business. She began her business because her parent did not see it necessary for a girl child to go to school. Instead, she was sent into early marriage at the age of 15 and since then she decided to go into business. 

Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, Hawa earns about Le 2,076,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy spring water (50 bundles at Le 25,000), luvian pure water (50 bundles @ Le 25,000), luvian water packets (58 packets of 1 litres @ Le 15,000), and magram (30 packets of 1.5 litres  @ Le 25,000).  The balance 380,000 is to be used for transportation.  

Hawa hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 416,000. In the future, she plans to give a quality education to her children, build a house, and have a bigger shop.  She felt good about taking this loan, which will help her to develop her business and generate more income.  A major challenge for her is the rise in cost and the scarcity in the supply of goods, which are so since several people are dealing in this product.  

Hawa always goes for the best that makes her business different  She serves 20 customers each day.  Her business is popular because she knows how to interact with customers and the items are used by the majority of people.  She treats her customers fairly and gives them the best of their demand.  She has one shop attendance.  She usually go for her supplies in Freetown three times each month by public transport.  She saves the profit she makes from the business.  She is hard working and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy water to resell

loans.name: Katheriane's Group

texts.en:
Katheriane has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her livestock business. 

With the loan investment, she will buy a dairy cow to get a larger quantity of milk. This will help her selling milk in larger quantities and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that her business will improve after the loan investment and it will help her family to live a better financial life.

Katheriane also performs her duties very well along with her business. Her husband is a farmer by profession. He is a very hard worker and work 8-10 hours a day. Katheriane has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are getting their education. She is hopeful about her family’s bright future as a result of an investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Katheriane.

loans.use: To buy a cow for livestock business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa was married early. At her age of 29, Melissa already has three children who are presently going to school. She is lucky she is married to a loving and hard working man. Melissa engages in a sari-sari store business where she sells grocery items. Her husband is a farmer and a dealer of native products like mats and hats that are made of abaca (banana fiber) 

Melissa has been in her sari-sari store business for eight years. She wants to make an expansion of her business site to accommodate her husband's products to sell. Melissa decided to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional grocery items like soft drinks, sugar, coffee, milk and spices to sell in their village. She wishes to expand the business as well as the products she offers to her customers to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items like soft drinks, sugar, coffee, milk and spices to sell in their village.

loans.name: Titomagba Group

texts.fr: TITOMAGBA est un groupement composé de quinze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupement du nom de Bèkpon est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bèkpon est âgée de 53 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Bèkpon est une veuve ayant cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et trois restent à sa charge. Bèkpon vit seule avec les trois enfants encore à sa charge et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Bèkpon vend des produits vivriers (maïs, etc.) à son domicile et dans sa région. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux des enfants à charge. Bèkpon s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Bèkpon et aux autres membres du groupement TITOMAGBA, de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The Titomagba group is made up of 15 people who all live in the same village and are all involved in income-generating activities. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their business activities and better satisfy customer demand.

Bèkpon, the woman with her hand raised in the picture, is the group's representative. She is 53 years old and lives in a town in Benin. She is widowed and has 5 children, some of whom attend school. 3 of the children are still dependent on their mother. She lives alone with them and is the family's sole breadwinner.

For the past 30 years, Bèkpon has been selling agricultural products (corn etc.) from her home and in her local area. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. The income from her business allows her to take care of her needs and those of her children.

This loan will enable Bèkpon and the other members of the Titomagba group to increase their business activity and thereby their turnover and revenue.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn for resale.

loans.name: Arslanbek

texts.ru: Арсланбеку 36 лет, женат, воспитывает троих детей, старший из которых учится в третьем классе. Основным источником дохода для семьи Арсланбека является животноводство, начатое им в 2010 году. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Арсланбека, его хозяйство насчитывает три коровы и десять овец и приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Арсланбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма. Доходы от кредита Арсланбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и достройку складских помещений. В будущем – Арсланбек мечтает дать образование своим детям.
texts.en: Arslanbek is 36 years old, married and is raising three children, the oldest of whom attends a third grade.  Animal husbandry business, started by Arslanbek in 2010, is the family's primary source of income.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, his business now has three cows and ten sheep and yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Arslanbek requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep for fattening up.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into a further increase of domestic livestock quantities and building storage buildings.  In the future, Arslanbek dreams of providing his children with education.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 36-year-old married woman with five children – four of them are in school. She has been selling bread in Yambio, South Sudan, for five years. Victoria is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old, married and has three school-age children. He is raising his family in a village, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables to sell. Despite the hardships in farming, they plan to educate their children and give them a bright future. Due to the high cost of school fees, they need to earn more income to support their schooling. 

They aim to improve their corn farming business to increase their yields and income. But due to inadequate capital, Michael is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs required for corn production. They mentioned that this loan will be a great help for them to work out their plan and they hope that they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Zainab.  She is married to a businessman and has 3 children, aged 9, 6 and 3 years.  In 2005, Zainab established her food vending  business. She began her business because she became pregnant when she was in school and after given birth, her parents refused support her.  Her fiancée gave her some money to start selling food and from then the business has grown to this day.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Zainab earns about Le 1,874,600 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Zainab has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy the following: tomato paste (30 cartons @ Le36,000), onions (10 bags @ Le100,000), vegetable oil (8 containers @ Le140,000), Maggie (6 cartons @ Le160,000), bottled water (2 bundles @ Le120,000).  The balance will be use to pay labourers.  

Zainab hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 374,920.  In the future, she plans to build a house and a shop, and educate her children to tertiary level.  She feels happy about taking this loan since it will help to improve her business.  Her major challenge is the weather, especially during the rains.  She only has one umbrella.  Her business is so popular because the items are use by the majority of people every day.  Her suppliers are in Freetown and she transports her items by public vehicle twice a month.  She ploughs some of her profit back into the business and keeps the balance to make her loan repayments.  She plans to expand her business and believes this can be achieved by proper utilization of her capital and profit.  She is hard-working and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hardware materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets, table cloths and veils for resale.

loans.name: Action Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born thirty-one years ago in Makeni city, Fatmata is married and has three children.  For eighteen years now, Fatmata has been a businesswoman. She currently sells groundnuts. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business -- she will buy groundnuts in large quantity to add to her business. 

This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella has two kids who she is sending to school. She is 35 years old and married. She runs a glassware and kitchenware business in the public market. To further support the needs of their children, Shella’s husband engages in the buying and selling of cars.

Shella needs additional working capital to maintain and continue operating her business. She chooses the ASKI organization for a loan because she knows they care for their clients. Shella is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional kitchenware and glassware to sell to her customers in the market. She wishes to continue growing her business to give a better way of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and glassware to sell to her customers in the market.

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Wulaymatu.  She is married to a mechanic & businessman, and has 3 children, aged 13 years, 4 years, and 4 months.  Two of her children are going to school.   

In 2008, Wulaymatu established her business selling baby diapers, pants, towels, babywear and wrappers.  She began her business because when her father died she was brought up by her stepmother who did not think it wise to see her through school.  She taught herself this business, which has been her source of income ever since.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,961,000 every month from her business. 

Wulaymatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 previous loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy children's jeans (2 dozens @ Le400,000), jeans skirts (2 dozen @ Le450,000), babywear (4 dozen @ Le250,000),  and blouses (3 dozens @ Le300,000).  The balance of 400,000 will be used for transport and other costs.   She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 490,000. 

In the future, Wulaymatu plans to open a well-secured shop where she can display her large stock.  She also wants to build a house and give her children a good education. She hopes to access more help in terms of loans for her business, as it is her only source of generating income.  The rain  is a major factor for her because her stall is not well covered.  The competition is high, but she always has a regular supply of goods that customers demand.  She serves people around the town, about 20 per day.  She treats her customers fairly and respects their wishes.  Her suppliers are located in Freetown where she travels three times per month, and Conakry where she goes once every month by public vehicle.  She saves some of  the income and uses the rest to buy more goods for her business.  She is hard working and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: jeans wears for children - 2 dozen @ Le400,000, jean skirt - 2 dozen @ Le450,000 baby wears - 4 dozen @ Le250,000 and blouses - 3 dozen @ Le300,000

loans.name: Edjromede Group

texts.fr: EDJROMEDE est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Adjoavi. Les membres du groupement résident dans le même village. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adjoavi est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Appolinaire. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, mais trois restent à leur charge. Adjoavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il  y a une vingtaine d'année,  Adjoavi fait la production de fromages au soja, qu'elle vend à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjoavi vend des poissons, des condiments et du maïs à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer sans grande difficulté les charges de ses enfants. Adjoavi achète ses produits dans sa région. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Adjoavi et aux autres membres du groupement EDJROMEDE, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The Edjromede group is made up of 15 people who all live in the same village. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé so that they can increase their working capital.

Adjoavi, the woman in the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s representative. She is 39 years old and married to a farmer called Appolinaire. The couple have 7 children, some of whom go to school. 3 of the children are still dependent on their parents.

Adjoavi has no formal education. For the past 20 years, she has been making soya cheese which she sells from her home. She also sells fish, condiments and corn from her home. She gets her supplies in her local area. The income from her business activities allows her to take care of her children without much difficulty.

This loan will enable Adjoavi and the other members of the Edjromede group to boost their business activities, increase their customer base and raise their revenue levels.

loans.use: to buy a bag of soya with which to make cheese.

loans.name: Kamathor Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Kamathor” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses.  

Magrete is the leader of this group. Magrete is 45 years old and married with six children –  one in primary school, one in secondary school and the others no longer attend school. Magrete sells market food – rice, palm oil, etc. She has been doing business for the past twenty years. With the help of this loan, Magrete is going to buy rice and palm oil in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygame à deux épouses.Il est père de 9 enfants dont les 4 sont des élèves.Il exerce le métier de chauffeur de camion dans un chantier d'exploitation de sable et de béton blanc , non loin de son village.En plus, il a un taxi de transport interurbain qui génère des revenus supplémentaires lui permettant de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Il sollicite auprés de UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour repeindre entièrement son taxi afin de le rendre plus attractif pour la clientèle.Son ambition est de terminer son bâtiment en construction pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a married polygamous man who has two spouses. He's the father of nine children, out of whom four attend school. He's a truck driver for a company that extracts sand and white concrete, not far from his village.

In addition, he has a taxi and offers interurban transportation services, which earns him an extra income and enables him to better provide for his family's needs.

He's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to entirely repaint his taxi and make it more attractive to customers. He ambitions to complete the house he is building for his family.

loans.use: to entirely repaint his taxi

loans.name: Adikalie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 60 year old Adikalie from Tengbehtown in the western area of Freetown. He is married with five children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. Two of his children attend school. 
 
Adikalie runs a provision shop at his store; he sells items such as milk, baked beans, sugar, sardines, and bread. He has been running this business for five years. He works at the business for 12 hours a day and seven days a week. His other source of income comes from renting out a house. Adikalie says that his business is going well.

Adikalie has requested a loan in order to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, and sardines. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, he plans to develop his business more. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as milk, sugar, and sardines.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Kadiatu. She is married to a driver and has two children, ages 31 and 28 years old. Her parents gave her to an aunt at the age of 5 to be taken care of, but her aunt's husband would not allow a girl child to attend school. They were business people; therefore, they introduced her to business. After she fully matured, she got married and started working on her own business.

In 1991, Kadiatu established a rice and palm oil business. Her suppliers are located in Freetown and Makeni. She transports her items by public vehicle and she buys her stock twice a month. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,413,600 leones (SLL) every month from this business. Her challenges are limited capital to buy more stock and fluctuation in foreign currency. Competition is high, but what makes her different from her competitors is that those who keep their business with her store buy more from her. She serves ten customers each day. Her business is popular because of good customer service.  

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy the following items: Indian rice (15 bags @ 152,000 SLL) and American rice (11 bags @ 145,000 SLL). The remaining 125,000 SLL will be used for transport. Kadiatu hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 2,827,200 SLL. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a house for her children. She feels good about taking this loan, because she will earn more income. This loan will help her to improve the business. She will plough back her profits into the business. Kadiatu is planning to expand and this can be accomplished through adequate utilization of her capital. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Indian rice and American rice

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей просит предоставить ему кредит для покупки семян, удобрений, системы полива и прочих вспомогательных материалов для теплиц. 

Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Алексей увеличил объемы посадок, смог эффективней использовать землю, получил больше прибыли с раннего урожая, так как поздний урожай был по очень низкой цене. Он смог применить более современные технологии обработки земли и посадки.

Алексей занимается сельских хозяйством давно, имеет самый большой участок в селе возле дома. 
Также у него есть собственная пилорама, где он работает в свободное время, когда есть заказы.
texts.en:
Alexei asks for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, watering systems and other material for greenhouses. 

Thanks to the previous loan, Alexei increased planting, was able to use the land effectively, and received a larger income from the early harvest, because late harvest had a much lower price. He was able to use more modern technologies for farming and planting. 

Alexei has long worked with farming, and owns the largest plot of land in the village close to his house. He also has his own sawmill, where he works in his spare time, when there are orders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, watering systems and other material for greenhouses

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa habite dans région du sud sénégal,marié depuis LE 09 janvier 2011,il a 1 enfant agé de 11 mois.
Moussa avait travaillé dans une usine de poisons pendant 4 ans qui fonctonne actuellement aux relenti.Depuis ces 4 dernières années ,il supportait toujours les charges de sa famille par son salaire dans l'usine.
Moussa avec ce crédit acheter du pain de singe du lait pour faire de la crème du jus et de la glace pour vendre dans une école qui est prés de son domicile pour faire face a ses charges de famille.Moussa a comme projet dans l'avenir construire sa maison en dure.
texts.en:
Moussa lives in South Senegal. He's been married since January 9, 2001, and has one child, age 11 months.

For four years, Moussa used to work in a fish factory whose business is currently running slow. After those four years, he was still supporting his family on his factory worker salary.

With this loan, Moussa will buy monkey-breads (fruits of the baobab tree) and milk to make cream, juice and ice-cream to resell in a school near his home, in order to meet his family's expenses.

In the future, Moussa projects to build a durable house.

loans.use: to buy monkey-breads (fruits of the baobab tree) and milk

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Having a plentiful harvest and a higher income is the goal of every farmer like Romeo, a 52-year-old father who aims to become successful someday. Despite the hardships of farming, he has the strong determination to improve his corn farming business. He has been a farmer for almost 34 years and usually earns a profit of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. He uses his income for basic necessities and allowances for his children. Being a hardworking father, he has educated all five of his children and most of them are now professionals.

Romeo plans to continue managing his business to earn and save for the future. He wants to ask for additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seed, fertilizers and insecticides needed for corn production. He believes that through hard work he will increase production and income.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers and insecticides needed for corn production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish stock for sale.

loans.name: Adama S

texts.en:
This is 32 year old Adama S. She is married to a carpenter, his monthly income is Le1,000,000, and they have four children aged 17, 13, 11 and 6 years who are all school-going children. 

In 2007, Adama established her utensil and household items business. She began her business because her parents did not allow her to go to school. Instead, she was given out for marriage at an early age. Her husband trained her in the business, since she did not learn any trade from her parents.

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,912,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy pans, hot pots, drinking buckets, and dishes. The balance of the loan is for transportation costs.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 478,000. In the future, Adama plans to build a larger outlet to display her goods; she is excited about the future as she wants her children to have a good education and a good standard of living. 

Rainy season is a major problem and also changes in foreign exchange rate are a problem. Competition is low as she is the only one dealing in that product. Adama serves people around the city and neighboring villages. She has good quality goods at an affordable price. Her suppliers are located in Conakry and in Freetown, where she usually goes two times per month by vehicle. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pans, dishes, and buckets

loans.name: Gladys K.

texts.en: Gladys is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 19. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past twelve years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Jlomawouton Group

texts.fr: JLOMAWOUTON est un groupement composé de quatorze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Gisèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gisèle est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Gisèle vend depuis huit ans environs, divers produits (riz, maïs, huile végétale) dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gisèle fait la transformation de manioc en farine de manioc, qu'elle vend également dans sa région. Gisèle s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Gisèle et les autres membres du groupement JLOMAWOUTON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en: JLOMAWOUTON is a group composed of 14 people who live in the same village. They all have an income-generating activity. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business and to better meet the needs of their customers. The group representative, Gisèle, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Gisèle is 31 and is married to a farmer named Roger. The couple takes care of their 4 children. Some of them go to school. They both take care of the family financially. Gisèle never went to school. To support her family, Gisèle has been selling various products (rice, corn, palm oil) in her area. In addition to that, Gisèle processes cassava into cassava flour, which she also sells in her area. Gisèle buys her supplies from Benin. It is the first time that Gisèle and the other members of JLOMAWOUTON are applying for a loan from ALIDÉ. This loan will be used to boost their business.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and of rice.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: With her desire to have a stable and productive source of income, Lilibeth chooses to run a variety store. She sells belts, bags, mirrors and Christmas lanterns when Christmas comes. Lilibeth is 47 years old, single and has one child. Usually, Lilibeth’s monthly income from the business is rolled over quickly for the growth of the business. Her customers are increasing. She needs additional capital to extend the products she sells to satisfy the needs of her customers. Lilibeth is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional bags, belts, umbrellas, and mirrors to sell in the market. She looks towards the success of her business and to becoming more productive.

loans.use: to buy additional bags, belts, umbrellas and mirrors to sell in the market.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between the ages of one and sixteen; all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Osman. He is married to a trader and has five children, ages 17, 15, 13, 11 and 2 years. After fifth form, he wanted to enter college but, unfortunately for him, his father died and he had nobody to support his schooling. Therefore, he was left with no other option but to go into business so that he could earn a living. 

In 1994, Osman established a business selling shirts, shorts, T-shirts, sneakers and shoes for both men and women. He is assisted by his distant cousin. Competition is high but he buys quality goods. He usually goes to Conakry twice per month by public vehicle. He serves people around town and his business is popular as his goods are always available when his customers need them. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,742,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. Rise in foreign exchange is one of his major problems. 

Osman would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan to buy jeans (50 pairs @ 47,000 SLL) and T-shirts (50 @ 24,000 SLL). The balance of 450,000 SLL is for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 411,000 SLL.

In the future, Osman plans to build a house and send his elder daughter for studies abroad. It is good for him to take out this loan because he will make extra profit from it. Osman will save some of his profit and add the balance to his existing capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans and T-shirts

loans.name: Pal

texts.en: Mrs. Pal, 49 years-old, is a responsible mother of four children.  She works hard day to day to go through the commune to sell her breakfast (Khmer noodle) to people. From this business, she is able to generate revenue of $2.00 per day. She is now preparing her soil to grow her dry-season rice again. She really needs some funds to make this process goes well. So she decided to seek her second loan from Kiva in order to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use on her farm. Her business goal is to expand her farming business and increase her output as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use on her farm.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is 34 -year-old Janet from Goderich, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 5 months and 13 years. She has two additional dependents with her and two of her children go to school. 
 
Janet runs a cooking supply store, selling cooking supplies such as cooking oil, onion, tomato paste, salt, bake beans and baking power. She has been running this business for 6 years. She works at the business from 8am until 6pm, six days per week. She also earns income from her husband, who is working as a contractor (house builder). She says that the main challenge to her business is low capital to invest in the business.

Janet has requested a loan in order to buy more food stuff commodities. The extra income from this loan will allow her to effectively take care of her children. In the future, she plans to open bigger store in the Goderich community. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more food stock such as cooking oil, tomato paste and onion.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells maize and beans.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improving her business structure. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père d'un bébé de trois mois.Il exerce le métier de menuisier métallique dans un atelier de son village.Il fabrique des portes, des fenêtres et autres produits métalliques qu'il vend à ses clients.Cette activité lui permis de prendre en charge ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.Il sollicite un prêt de 100000f pour réparer son" maule"  qui est tombé en panne depuis un mois. Son ambition est d'acquérir un véhicule de transport afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man who is father to a baby of three months old. He is a metal worker in a workshop in his village and makes doors, windows and other metal goods, which he sells to his customers. This business allows him to provide for his own needs as well as those of his family. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to repair his "mold" which broke a month ago. His ambition is to acquire a transport vehicle so that he can diversify his income.

loans.use: to repair his metal "mould"

loans.name: Mahoudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUDJRO est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et se connaissent de par leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anne-Marie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Anne-Marie est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Rodrigue. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge, et certains scolarisés. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Anne-Marie fait de la restauration (riz accompagné de sauce) dans une école de sa région ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Anne-Marie achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Anne-Marie et les autres membres du groupement MAHOUDJRO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Mahoudjro group consists of thirteen people who all live in the same village and know each other from their businesses. The representative of this group, named Anne-Marie, is the one whose hand is raised on the photo. Anne-Marie is 35-years-old and is married to a farmer named Rodrigue. The couple has four children, all under their care, and some go to school. 

For about ten years, Anne-Marie has been providing catering services (rice accompanied by sauce) in a school in her region, which allows her to take care of the diverse responsibilities of her family together with her husband. Anne-Marie buys her products in Bénin. 

This is the first time that Anne-Marie and the other members of the Mahoudjro group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to the demands of their clientèle.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Аваз проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Аваз занимается шитьем и торговлей чехлов для машин. Этим видом деятельности занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Avaz lives in the city Isfara. He is 36 years old and married. He has two children. Avaz works with sewing and trading covers for cars. He has been in this business for 18 years. He takes out a loan to purchase fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 38 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children; 4 of them are currently in school. For the past 6 years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells maize and beans. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans for resale, and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Dorothy hopes that in the future that she will be able to expand her business. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a responsible house wife, Mary Jane owns and manages a variety store in their village to generate income. She is 37 years-old and has one school-age child. She and her husband aim to improve their variety store and their rice farming business in order to have a viable source of income in the future. 

In this regard, Mary Jane wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an a loan of P25,000 in order to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, junk food, rice and load wallets for sale. She believes that her patience and hard work will make her business grow and be profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, junk food, rice and load wallets to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sansao

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, de 26 anos de idade fez a 9ª classe. Vive maritalmente na casa própria. E pai de 2 filhos Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e dois sobrinhos que vive com ele em sua casa consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancária, pois tem tido trabalhos extras de mecânica.
 É  seguranca na Empresa G4S em turnos no periodo da manhã das 7:00h as 17:00h e no periodo da noite das 17:00h as 7:00 do dia seguinte estando a operar a mais de 6 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra.este e seu quarto emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar(cimento, ferros , barrotes e chapas de zinco) para concluir a cobertura da sua casa.
Prtende  futuramente adquirir um minibus para tranportar passageiros.
texts.en:
Sansao was born in the District of Namaacha. He is 26 years old and finished ninth grade. He lives with his partner in his own home. He has two children, and financially supports his mother and two nephews, who live with him. He saves 1,000 meticals a month in his bank account, as he gets extra work as a mechanic.
He works as a security guard in the company G4S, taking the 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. shift one day and the 5 p.m. to 7 a.m. shift the next. He has worked there for more than six years and uses his salary to cover household expenses and the construction on his house. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 18,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, beams, sheet metal, etc.) to finish roofing his house.
In the future, he'd like to buy a minibus to transport passengers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, beams, sheet metal).

loans.name: Philip A

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Philip.  He is single, and has one child aged three years old. In 1996, Philip established his balusters, files and blocks business. He began his business because he found it difficult to continue his schooling.  He decided to join his elder brother in the production of bricks and balusters for sale until he became financially strong enough to establish his own shop.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,559,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Philip has already received and successfully repaid one loan.  He now requires a new loan in order to purchase: cement (50 bags @ SLL 44,000); iron (30 pieces @ SLL 15,000); and sand (20 trips @ SLL 60,000). The balance amount would be for transportation. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 750,000.

In the future, Philip plans to build a house and further his education. He is nervous about the future because he wants a better standard of living. The loan will help a lot as it is his secondary source of income. His major challenge is high taxes levied by the local district council. Competition is not too high, as two businesses are dealing in the same product. He serves contractors and individuals involved in construction and he serves about 10 customers per day. Philip offers a quality product; that is why his business is popular. His suppliers are located in Makeni. He usually buys his goods twice a month by public transport. He saves some and the remainder to add to the capital of the business. He is planning to expand if he has the resources to so. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Zita

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, é casada vive na casa própria com sua familia, e mae de 4 filhos todos vao a escola. Responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela.
 É  proprietaria de um estabelecimento  comercial  localizado na sua residência, vende produtos de primeira necessidade e bebidas alcoolicas. Tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa, este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku  no valor de 10.000.00m com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria nomeadamnete( bolachas, acucar , arroz e bebidas alcoolicas) o anterior de 6.000.00mt foi usado também para o comércio.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros emprestimos. Pretende futuramente construir uma esplanada dando assim mais conforto aos seus clientes
texts.en:
Zita was born in the district of Namaacha. She is married and lives in her own home with her family. She has four children, who are all in school. She also supports her niece, who lives with her.
She runs a business out of her home selling staple goods and alcohol. She earns 4,000 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will invest in expanding the amount of merchandise she carries (crackers, sugar, rice, and alcohol). Her previous loan for 6,000 meticals was also used for the business.
She is confident that she will pay off this loan early and request additional loans. In the future, she plans to build a walkway so her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (crackers, sugar, rice, and alcohol) for her shop.

loans.name: Solomon   S

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Solomon from Goderich, from the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He has two employees working for him. He is married with on child, age 5.

In 2003, Solomon established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income to support his family. He works at the business from 7am until 10pm, seven days per week. He is also qualified in information technology hardware, computer mechanics and phone repairs. This is another source of income for him. He says that the main challenge to his business is competition.

Solomon requires a loan in order to buy more malaria drugs, cold syrup, gripe water, paracetamol syrup and blood tonic. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, Solomon plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more malaria drugs, cold syrup, blood tonic and gripe water.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past four years, Sophie has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sophie to generate greater profits and increase in her capital. Sophie hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house.

Sophie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sophie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Мансуру 50 лет, женат, воспитывает четверых детей. Основным источником дохода для семьи Мансура является животноводство, начатое им в 2007 году на кредит компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Мансура,  в  его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется дойная корова и 28 баранов, а также заготовлено 500 кг хлопка на продажу.
В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Мансур обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Мансур планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в  будущем –дать образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Mansur is 50 years old, married and raising four children. The main source of income for Mansur's family is animal breeding, which he began in 2007 after a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners". Thanks to Mansur's persistence and perseverance, he currently has one dairy cow and 28 sheep on his farm, and also a harvest of 500 kilos of cotton for sale. 

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Mansur turned to the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle for fattening. Mansur plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock, and in the future provide education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boxes of perfume, beauty lotion, hair extensions and rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with ome of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells phones.

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones for resale, and will help Paul to generate greater profits and improve his family's standards of living. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land and own a bigger shop that sells phones. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones for resale.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Saidu. He is married and his spouse is a student, and has one child aged 4 years old. In 2009, Saidu established his mobile phone accessories, top-up cards, DVD cassettes business. He began his business because he dropped out of school due to poor living standard of his family. His parents usually paid his fees late and he was frequently embarrassed and beaten for school fees. He later left school and became a vehicle apprentice. He spent some years there and decided to go into business.

Working 7 days a week and 19 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,448,000 every month from this business, he would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy phone accessories (20 @ SLL 120,000), DVDs (1 carton @ SLL 600,000), phone batteries (200 pcs @ SLL 7,000); the remaining amount is for transport.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 411,000. In the future, Saidu plans to build a house, improve on his farm and educate his child to university level. His feels happy about taking this loan that will help to improve his business and earn more income. His major problem is sometimes the generator breaks down. There is no competition. He is the only one selling these items is that area. He serves 50 customers each day. His business is popular because he knows how to encourage customers. He has only family assistance. His suppliers are located in Conakry. He transports his items by public vehicle and he buys twice in a month. He uses his profit from the business to buy more stock. He is planning to expand and this can be achieved by managing his capital appropriately. He is assisted by his distant cousin. He saves some profit and use the balance to his existing capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories, DVDs and phone batteries.

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.ru: Сайёра замужем и в воспитании имеет двух несовершеннолетних детей. Она целеустремленная и добрая женщина. Сайёра более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Её торговая точка находится  на центральном рынке города. Она продает канцелярские товары и промтовары. Сайёра работает усердно, чтобы стать успешным предпринимателем. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки новых товаров с целью пополнения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Saiyora is married and is raising two minor children. She is a purposeful and good woman. Saiyora has worked in retail for more than 15 years. Her outlet is located in the central market in town. She sells office supplies and manufactured goods. 

Saiyora works diligently to become a successful entrepreneur. She would like to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni for the purchase of merchandise to re-stock.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 47 лет, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.  Для того, чтобы покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи, Айнагул в 1990 году начала свой бизнес в разведении скота, ставший затем основным источником финансирования ее семьи.  Использовав стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы, Айнагул смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день две дойной коровы, четыре бычка, четыре лошади и пятьдесят овец. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Айнагул планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы вложить в оплату контракта на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 47 years old, married and has five children. In order to cover the daily expenses of her family, Ainagul started her business of breeding cattle in 1990. This later became the main source of income for her family. Using a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow, Ainagul was able to develop the farm. It currently numbers two dairy cows, four bulls, four horses and fifty sheep. The monthly income from selling dairy products and meat is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Ainagul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. In the future, Ainagul plans to increase the number of livestock, and use the income to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kadiatu
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years and she is married to Charles. They are blessed with two children, aged 25 and 21 respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan  with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Helen will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and later venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children aged 18 to 24 who are in school and live at home. For the past sixteen years, Susanna has been selling fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics from a table in the market. She established the business with money that she received from her parent. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics for her business. She enjoys the independence that her income gives her. Her plans is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers, blouses, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a single woman. She describes herself as an ambitious and honest woman. She runs a retail store and sells home products such as sugar, salt, blue band etc. She has been in this business for five years. She was previously involved in farming. Her business challenge is the increased cost of items sold. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy home products such as royco, sugar, flour etc. In the next five years, Ann hopes to run a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more home product such as royco, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Ibrahim from Waterloo branch, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 years and 21 years. Two of his children attend school. He started this type of business because it is not diminishing in value.
 
Ibrahim runs an assorted goods store at his marketplace. He sells items such as shoes, bags, suitcases and grinding machines. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business from 7am until 6pm, 6 days per week. His business is the only source of income he has. Ibrahim says that the main challenge to his business is high cost of income tax.
 
Ibrahim has requested a loan in order to buy some assorted goods. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his saving and educate his children. In the future, he plans to do international business, especially with China. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags, suitcases and grinding machines.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is married and has two children, ages six and seven years old. She describes herself as an honest and God-fearing woman. For the last two years she has been involved in tailoring activity. She sells dresses made for retailers. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will be using the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more cloth materials. Martha hopes and dream to run a bigger tailoring shop in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy cloth and material for sewing.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old, married to Ruth. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Sultanmurod

texts.ru: Султонмурод занимается выращиванием селхозкультур. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. На иждивении имеет сноху и внуков. Полученный урожай он продает на рынке «Дусти». Он начинал бизнес с купли продажи сельхозкультур, а потом постепенно сам стал выращивать их и получил хорошую прибыль. Султонмурод хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче смазочных материалов, а часть займа хочет использовать для оплаты труда работников.
texts.en: Sultanmurod is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and has five children.  He also supports his daughter-in-law and grandchildren.  Sultanmurod sells his harvest at the "Doosti" market.  He started his own business with buying and selling agricultural crops, then gradually began growing them himself and made a good profit.  Sultanmurod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and use part of the loan to pay for his employees' work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel, and to pay for his employees' work

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Nasceu na localidade de Muchope, Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta a Escola. Fez a formação de professores e naõ continuou com os estudos por falta de tempo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta uma irma e sobrinha que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo para continuar com os seus estudos, actualmente é docente e quadro do Ministerio da educação ha 10 anos, para alem do seu emprego tem um negocio de venda de produtos diversos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.500.00mt por mês e 14.200.00mt de salario e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo no BIM e pagou sem dificuldades e mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açucar, refrescos, sabaõ e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00, 12.005.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial e aumentar a quantidade do seu produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armando was born in the town of Muchope, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is in school. He was training to be a teacher but did not complete his studies because he didn't have time. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports a sister and a niece, who live with him.

He left Gaza for Maputo to continue his studies. He's worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for more than 10 yeras, and he also has a shop selling a variety of products. He earns about 12,500 meticals a month at the shop and a salary of 14,200 meticals, which he uses for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (BIM).
He had one loan through BIM, which he paid off without difficulty, and then learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap, etc.) to increase the quantity and variety of merchandise he carries. His previous loans, in the amounts of 12,000, 12,005, and 13,000 meticals, were also used for his business.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his shop and increase the quantity of merchandise he carries.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap, etc.) for his shop.

loans.name: Alice Njoki

texts.en: Alice, 45 years old, is a single woman with a 22-year-old daughter. She is a self-motivated woman. For the last eight years, she has been selling clothes such as skirts, suits and blouses. In addition, she does farming to add to her source of income. Sometimes, she has low purchasing power from the customers. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy two bales of skirts and suits. Alice hopes to be the leading supplier in her town in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy two bales of skirts and suits.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Lamin. He is married to a businesswoman and has three children aged 7, 5 and 1 year old. One of his children is a school-going child. In 1999, Lamin established his jeans, polo, shirts, lacoste and trousers etc. business. He began his business because he did not go to school but rather joined his father in farming. After he fully matured, he left farming in the village for the city. In the city, he helped to sell for somebody on commission where he accumulated some funds, which he used to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,437,100 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan for Le 4,000,000.  Lamin has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase used clothing. He wants to purchase the following items:  T-shirts 2 bales @ Le 580,000, Lacoste 2 bales @ Le 650,000 and trousers 2 bales @ Le 700,000. He will use the balance of the loan to pay for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 287,420.  

In the future, Lamin plans to provide a quality education for his children, build a house and have a shop.  He felt good about taking this loan and the loan will help him to improve his business and his family's standard of living.  His major challenge is that sometimes the bales he buys contain spoiled/damaged clothing. He serves 15 customers each day. His business is popular because he sells quality used clothing. Lamin does not have any employees. His suppliers are located in Conakry and he transports his good by public transport. He buys three times in a month.  He plows back the profit into the business. He is planning to expand and this will accomplish by acquiring more loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a single man. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He has been selling home products for the last eight years. Previously, he was involved in a farming business. His business challenge is the high cost of goods sold when buying. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more home products. Roberts hopes in the next five years, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 38 years old, married and lives in Buchanan with four children aged 7 months to 15 years old. They all live at home. For the past 21 years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than the large amounts of travel involved, which can be difficult with a small child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mae de 4 filhos dos um ainda esta a fazer a faculdade e os outros ja lincenciados. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua sogra enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

É comerciante ha mais de 20 anos e o seu produto preferido e carne que compra no Reino da Suazilandia e revende em Boane, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt a 5.000.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açucar, refrescos, sabaõ e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00, 30.000.00, 40.000.00mt e 45.000.00mt aplicados para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um talho, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in the city of Maputo, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has four children; two of them are still in college, and the others have graduated from college. Veronica finished sixth grade and did not continue with school because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother-in-law by sending her some money to help with household expenses.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years, and her favorite product to sell is meat. She buys it in the Kingdom of Swaziland and resells it in Boane, which gives her an income of around 4,000 to 5,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Veronica has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her fifth Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap and other items) to increase and diversify her inventory. The earlier loans were for 15,000 meticais, 30,000 meticais, 40,000 meticais and 45,000 meticais, and all were for the same purpose.

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future she intends to build a butcher's shop. In order to do that, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell meat and other products (rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks, soap, etc.).

loans.name: Turdimurod

texts.ru: Турдимурод более 11 лет занимается растениеводством. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он берет кредит закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян моркови.
texts.en: Turdimurod has been involved in agriculture for over 11 years.  He is 56 years old, married and has five children.  His son works in the Russian Federation.  Turdimurod is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and carrot seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and carrot seeds

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул разведенная. У нее двое детей. Она любящая мать своих детей. Она старательная и трудолюбивая женщина. Для содержания своих детей в хороших условиях она начала заниматься купле- продажей детской одежды и обуви. Она любит свой бизнес и ей приятно видит улыбку на лице детей, когда они уходят довольными. Орзигул запрашивает займ для покупки новых зимней одежды для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Orzigul is divorced. She is a loving mother of two children. She is a diligent and hard-working woman. In order to provide good living conditions for her children, Orzigul started selling children's clothing and footwear. She loves her business and is pleased to see a smile on children's faces when they leave her store happy. Orzigul is requesting a loan in order to purchase new winter clothing and to increase her working capital. She is hoping for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: to buy children's winter clothing for her store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Matola, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mae de 2 filhos ainda sem idade para Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

É trabalhadora de uma empresa de segurança ha mais de 7 anos e o seu salario é 3.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Eugenia was born in Matola city, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who are not old enough for school yet. Eugenia finished sixth grade and did not continue because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has worked at a security company for more than seven years, and her salary is 3,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Eugenia has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Eugenia's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, beams, sand and other items) so she can continue construction work on her house. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for the same purpose.

Eugenia promises to make her payments on time. She wants to finish her house and furnish it one day, and to do that she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, beams, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Thuku

texts.en:
Thuku is 66 years old and married to Irene. They are blessed with two children, aged 28 and 24.  He has been in the farming business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

Thuku is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Thuku will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Dado est une femme âgée de 25 ans. Elle est célibataire et a 01 enfant.
Dado travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend de la liqueur. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.  Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Dado a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des liqueurs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dado voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins et de son enfant.
texts.en: Dado is a 25 year old woman. She is single with one child.  Dado has worked as a retailer since 2006. She sells liquor. She buys the products in Lome. She works alone. Right now, she does not have any problems.  Dado is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy liquor.  She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Dado would like to open a store. She says that with the profits, she plans support herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is married and has two children, ages six months and one year. She is an ambitious woman.  She has been selling khat for the last six years in an area conducive for the business.  She was previously involved in a farming activity and engaged in khat selling to increase her income. Her business challenge is the high cost of khat when buying it. She plans that with the loan of Kes 10,000 she will be able to boost her business by buying more khat for selling.  Judy dreams and hopes to diversify her business in the next five years.

loans.use: buy khat to sell

loans.name: Irama

texts.fr:
Irama habite dans région du sud sénégal,agé de 38 ans,marié depuis 2001,il travail depuis 2003 dans société de gardiennage située dans la localité .Père de 2 enfants qui sont tous à l'école le plus agé a 8 ans,il fait la classe du cp et le petit fait la case des tous petits.
Irama avec ce crédit il achete des fournitures scolaire des enfants.Irama a comme objectif d'avenir le soutien des enfants pour leurs réussite à l'école,car lui il n'a pas eu la change à l'école.
texts.en:
Irama lives in the south Senegal region. He is 38 years old, married since 2001, and has been working since 2003 with a security company. He is father to two children who are both in school. The eldest is 8 years old and is in primary class, and the little one is in the class for toddlers.

With this loan Irama would like to buy school supplies for his children. Irama's goal for the future is to support his children to succeed in school, because he himself did not have the chance to go to school.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Angeluica

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mae de 7 filhos 3 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola e outros ja trabalham. Fez 3ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

É comerciante e dona do seu negocio ha mais de 12 anos, vende material de construção onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) e mais algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição.
