Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para revenda (cimento e areia) para a produção de blocos e vender. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Angeluica was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has seven children; three of them still go to school and the rest are working. Angeluica finished third grade and did not continue because her parents could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

She has had her own business for more than 12 years. Angeluica sells construction materials and earns an income of about 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses, saves some through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings) and saves more in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Angeluica's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement and sand) so she can make and sell blocks. The previous loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for the same purpose.

She promises to make her payments on time. She intends to expand her business activity one day, and in order to do that she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for making blocks.

loans.name: Joseph Mbaabu

texts.en: Joseph is married and has two children, ages five and sixteen years. He is an ambitious man. He runs three businesses:  a cattle sales business, a grocery store, and a retail store.  He has been running these businesses for the last fifteen years. Joseph has one employee. His business challenge is the high cost of home products and vegetables when buying.   He will use the loan for Kes 20,000 to buy more home products and vegetables. Joseph hopes and plans to diversify his businesses in the next five years.

loans.use: buy home products and vegetables

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and is married to Nelson. They are blessed with two children, aged 13 and 9 years. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which she uses to support her family.

Pauline is applying for her first  loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer  for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 24 years old, married and has one child who is two years old.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes.  She has employed one person in her business.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business well.  This is because she has been trained on good business management skills.

Caroline has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Jossias

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos que ainda frequentam Escola. Fez somente 1ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

É comerciante e dono do seu negocio ha mais de 10 anos, vende produtos diversos no quintal da sua casa onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, massas, farinha, sardinhas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt e 8.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e adquirir gado bovino para a criaçaõ, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jossias was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has five children who still go to school. Jossias only finished first grade and did not continue because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Jossias has had his own business for more than ten years. He sells a variety of products from the yard of his house, and he earns about 5,500 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvukut through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Jossias' fourth Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 10,000 meticais so he can buy products (rice, pasta, flour, sardines and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were for 6,000 meticais, 7,000 meticais and 8,000 meticais, all used for the same activity.

Jossias promises to make his payments on time. He intends to expand his business one day and also buy some cattle to raise. In order to do those things, Jossias intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, pasta, flour, sardines, etc.).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 55 years old and a single mother of one adult child. She has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her child.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lilian will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her farming. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta Escola. Fez o nivel primario e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

É comerciante e dono do seu negocio ha mais de 5 anos, vende produtos de 1ª necessidade onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 30.000.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo no TCHUMA uma cooperativa de microcreditos e pagou sem dificuldades, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, tomate, arroz, massas, farinha, sardinhas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armindo was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has three children; one of the children goes to school. Armindo finished elementary school and did not continue because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two relatives [nieces or nephews] who live with him.

He has had his own business for more than five years. Armindo sells staple goods and earns about 30,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He had a loan before at Tchuma, a microcredit cooperative, and paid it back without any trouble. Later he learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Armindo's third Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais so he can buy products (fish, tomatoes, rice, pasta, flour, sardines and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais; both were for the same purpose.

He promises to make his payments on time. Armindo wants to expand his business and finish building his house one day. To do these things, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, tomatoes, rice, pasta, flour, sardines, etc.).

loans.name: Eshdavlat

texts.ru: Эшдавлат в основном занимается выращиванием и продажей картошки, пшеницы и лука. Он женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей из них трое несовершеннолетние. Жена присматривает за детьми и занимается домашними делами. Кроме этого он занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе ему помогает семья в основном его дочка и сын. Эшдавлат хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Eshdavlat is mostly engaged in growing and selling potatoes, wheat and onions. He is married and is raising six children, including three minors. His wife looks after the children and takes care of the household. Eshdavlat also raises cattle. His family, particularly one daughter and one son, help him with the business. Eshdavlat would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Meet 35 -year-old Hassan from Goderich in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of three and 10 years. Two of his children are currently attending school. His other source of income comes from commercial bikes. In 2004, Hassan established his building material store. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income. He works at his business 30 days every month. Even though his customer base has grown, his operating capital is not sufficient for maintaining an inventory of products with high turnover.

Hassan requires a loan in order to buy more building materials such cables, fitting, shovels, head pans, toilet seats, paint, iron rods, and cement. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to solve one of his eye sight problems, make greater profits, and improve his family's welfare. In the future, Hassan plans to open an outlet in another location in the same community. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more building materials such as cables, fitting, paint, iron rods, and cement.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old and married to Ruth. They are blessed with two children aged 24 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mamarazhab

texts.ru: Мамаражаб занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он хочет улучшить жилищные условия и обеспечить своих детей более на высоком уровне. Мамаражаб хочет обрабатывать землю, чтобы получить хороший урожай на следующий сезон. С этой целью ему необходимо минеральные удобрения. Для этой покупки он просит вас о помощи и запрашивает займ в размере 1200 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mamarazhab is involved in growing and selling agricultural crops.  He is married and has three children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mamarazhab wants to improve his living conditions and provide more for his children.  He wants to treat his land in order to obtain a good harvest next season.  He needs mineral fertilizers to achieve this goal.  Mamarazhab is asking you for help with this purchase and is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 Somoni.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 41 años es soltero, tiene un hijo de diez años. El nos cuenta que es de profesion carpintero y herrero desde hace más de diez años, tiene su taller en la Ciudad de Paraguarí, dice que toda su familia se ha dedicado a este trabajo, por lo que ya tiene un poco de conocimientos sobre el tema.
Comenta que su negocio lo ha ayudado mucho en la manutención de la casa, ya que el día a día está muy duro u es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo hasta ser más conocido por la zona y de esa forma poder expandirse.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que necesita poder llegar más rápido junto a sus clientes de la carpintería y de la herrería. A la vez nos dice que esta será una herramienta de trabajo muy útil.
texts.en:
Víctor is from the city of Paraguarí.  He is 41 years old and single, and has a 10-year-old son.  He tells us that he has been a carpenter and blacksmith by profession for more than 10 years.  His workshop is in the city of Paraguarí.  He says that his whole family has done this work, so he already has a bit of knowledge on the topic.

He comments that his business has helped him a lot in maintaining his house, since day by day it is very hard and this is why he makes an effort to his full capacity.  One of his goals is to continue growing to be better known in the area and in this way be able to expand.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle because he needs to be able to reach his carpentry and blacksmithing customers more quickly.  He also tells us that it will be a very useful work tool.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for work.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her son. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to stay in the business and improve it. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 71-year-old widow with four adult children. She has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan  with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her farming. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Meshark

texts.en: Meshark, 48 years old, is married and has five children. He describes himself as a social and focused man. For the last one year, he has been in the tailoring business and sells sweaters and dresses to residents in his area. His business challenge is the high cost of material used for sewing these clothes. He will use the loan Kes 10,000 to buy wool and material for sewing new clothes. Meshark hopes and plans to run a boutique in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes materials (fabric) and wool for sewing.

loans.name: Anaprofes 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "ANAPROFES 4" est composée de 5 femmes mariées qui exercent toutes dans le commerce de produits alimentaires, de légumes et de poisson frais et séché.Elles habitent dans le même quartier et s'appuient mutuellement dans leurs activités à travers une tontine qui les réunie un après midi du 5 de chaque mois.Elles soutiennent leurs maris dans les dépenses de la famille notamment celle de la nourriture.Le chef du groupe ( en vert, à gauche) est mère de quatre enfants qui vont tous à l'école. Elle vend des légumes et du poisson frais sur une table installée devant son domicile. Elle parvient à subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins et à améliorer l'alimentation de la famille.Elle supplée aussi de temps en temps son mari dans la prise en charge des frais médicaux des enfants. Son ambition est de construire une cantine devant chez elle.Le groupe , pour augmenter ses revenus , sollicite un pret de 600000f afin d'acheter des produits alimentaires et des produits halieutiques.
texts.en: The Anaprofes 4 group is made up of five married woman who all trade in groceries, vegetables and fresh and frozen fish. They live in the same neighborhood and mutually rely on a "tontine" system (a revolving finance system where each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members) whereby they meet in the afternoon of the fifth day of every month. They help out their husbands with the family expenditure, notably food. The leader of the group (in green on the left of the photo) is mother to four children, who all attend school. She sells vegetables and fresh fish on a table which has been set up in front of her house. She manage to provide for most of her needs and improve her family's food. She also stands in for her husband sometimes in covering her children's medical costs. Her ambition is to build a stall in front of her house. In order to increase its income, the group is requesting a loan of 600,000 francs so that they can buy food and fishing products.

loans.use: to buy food and fishing products

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.ru: Рузи целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Рузи занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и откармливанием крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он является владельцем бизнеса и начинал бизнес 5 лет назад. Раньше он занимался купле продажей мелкого рогатого скота, а потом постепенно начинал выращивать сельхозпродукты. Рузи запрашивает займ для покупки мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Ruzi is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He is married and is a responsible father of four children.  Ruzi is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle and small livestock.  He is the owner of this business, which he started five years ago.  Previously, he was involved in buying and selling small livestock and then gradually started to grow agricultural crops.  Ruzi is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock and cattle.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and small livestock

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Joan has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for resale and will help Joan to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a big salon. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Joan's future prospects by helping her to manage to take care of her children and her mother.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Yusifu S

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Yusifu S.  He is married to a businesswoman and has 4 children aged 18, 13, 11 and 3 years respectively. In 1996, Yusifu S established his jeans, polo shirts, Lacoste clothes, and bags business. He started business at the time his father died when he was in form two (education level) and there was no other financial support. He decided to leave school and went to a mining area. He engaged in mining and acquired some funds which he used to start his business.   Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,510,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Yusifu S has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase jeans 70 pieces @ Le35,000, shirts 36 pieces @ Le25,000, lacoste - 24 pieces @ Le22,000. The balance of the loan will be used for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,160. In the future, Yusifu S plans to complete his construction building, educate his children, and he also wants to open another shop. His major challenge is the fluctuation in foreign currency.  Competition is high but he is different from his competitors because he always has what the customers want.  He serves 10 customers each day.  His business is popular because he provides good customer care and he has quality items. Yusifu does not have any employees. His suppliers are located in Conakry, Guinea and he transports his goods by public transport. He buys three times in a month.  He ploughs the profit back into the business.  He plans to expand and this will be accomplished by acquiring more loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, and Lacoste clothes

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in the Ddmashen village area of Sevan. He is 54 years old, married and has two sons. 

Tigran graduated from a technological secondary school, and after that he worked as an electrician for 17 years. After that, he started beekeeping. The past three years he has engaged in animal breeding as well. On his farm, Tigran rears cows, sheep and chickens. Only his wife helps him in his occupation, as Tigran’s sons live in Russia. Tigran sells agricultural produce from his farm. 

Tigran says beekeeping is the hardest, but at the same time, it's a very profitable business so he emphasizes it. He always produces high quality honey and thanks to that, he has many regular customers. 

This is Tigran’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his repayments. 

Now Tigran needs a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy some bee families, a cow and fodder for his farm animals. This will allow Tigran to develop his farm and thus to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy some bee families, a cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in Buchanan.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children ages 14 to 18 who are in school and live at home.  For the past eleven years, she has been selling blouses and slippers in the market.  She established the business with small loans from friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses and slippers to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: buy blouses and slippers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 52 years old, married and has two children. She owns a motorbike which she uses for a transport business.  She also practices farming for more income generation.  She has retained the two business through her hard work and determination.  

Rose hopes to own a vehicle for her transport business instead of using a motorbike.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он является фермером в дехканском хозяйстве и занимается посевом ячменя и клевера. Одновременно занимается скотоводством. Часть выращенного урожая  уходит на корм скота, а остальную часть продает за хорошие цены. Жена помогает по бизнесу особенно во время посева семян. Уктам запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки высококачественные семена ячменя и клевера, а на остальную сумму хочет купить крупный  и мелкий рогатый скот.
texts.en: Uktam is married and has one child.  He is a farmer at a dekhan farm and is involved in sowing barley and clover.  Concurrently, he is involved in animal husbandry.  Uktam uses some of his harvest to feed the livestock and sells the rest at good prices.  His wife helps him with the business, especially during the sowing of seeds.  Uktam is requesting a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni to purchase high-grade barley and clover seeds and to buy cattle and small livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds and livestock

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's Group is comprised of 2 hard-working women.  Rose is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past year, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pays her children’s school fees. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to take her children to a good school. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her to develope her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to resell

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria's Group is comprised of 2 hard-working women.  Maria is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Maria has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair braids,  and will help Maria generate greater profits and take care of her family. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Maria's future prospects by helping her to learn to handle her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair braids for her salon

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme , récemment mariée et sans enfants.Elle tient un salon de coiffure et vend également des chaussures et des sacs.Ces deux activités lui permettent de se prendre entièrement en charge et d'épargner une partie de ses bénéfices.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter 5 douzaines de sacs et 5 douzaines de chaussures.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une cantine au marché central de sa ville.
texts.en: The borrower is a young woman, recently married and without children.  She owns a hair salon and also sells shoes and handbags.  These two businesses allow her to support herself completely and to save a part of her profits.  To increase her working capital, she is asking for a loan of 200000 francs in order to buy 5 dozen handbags and 5 dozen shoes.  Her ambition is to open a canteen in her city's central market.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen handbags and 5 dozen shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Adamsay G

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Adamsay G. She is married to a driver and has five children aged 17, 15, 10, 7 and 3 years. Four of the children are going to school. In 1993, Adamsay G. established her groundnut business. She began her business because her parents did not allow her to go to school and she had to take care of the younger ones and assist her mother in selling local foodstuffs.  After she was fully grown, her mother gave her some money to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,349,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Adamsay G. has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to purchase 10 bags of groundnuts @ Le 420,000. The remaining funds from the loan will be used for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 269,920. 

In the future, Adamsay G. plans to build a house, educate her children to tertiary level and to have a store. She felt happy about taking this loan because it will help her to improve her business and earn more income.  Her major challenge is the frequent changes in the price of the goods.  Competition is keen and she overcomes her competitors by selling at a reduced cost. Adamsay G. serves 10 customers each day. Her business is popular because she has good interpersonal relationships with her customers.  She is assisted by family members. Her suppliers are located at Bamoi Town Lumor (Market Days Centre) and she transports her goods by public transport.  She buys four times a month. She uses part of her profit to pay her loan and reinvests the balance in the business. She is planning her business and this can be achieved through proper utilization of her profit. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her hair dressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids for the hair and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a taxi. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to learn How to handle her customers.

loans.use: to buy braids for the hair

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 32 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with a four year-old child  that is in school and lives at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a "cook shop" (restaurant). She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, peppers, soft drinks, and onions for her business.  In the future, she plans to travel and become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, peppers, soft drinks, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, quien se dedica a la albañilería. Nicolasa es artesana, teje encaje jhu y ao po´i.
Cuenta que desde muy joven se dedica a este trabajo, lo cual aprendió de su mamá, por lo que ya tiene muy buena experiencia en esto. Dice que gracias al amor que le pone a su trabajo tiene buenos resultados por que le salen muy lindas las prendas y eso a la vez la ayuda a tener un buen ingreso. Hace 40 años que teje. Y ahora ella enseña a sus sobrinas e interesadas del lugar. Vende sus artesanías por las casas artesanales de Carapeguá y también recibe pedidos de Asunción.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de hilos, telas, colores y demás insumos necesarios para sus bordados. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que se le está dando.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is from the city of Carapeguá.  She is 61 years old and a single mother.  She has a son who works in construction.  Nicolasa is an artisan.  She makes "jhu" lace and "ao po´i" [embroidered cotton cloth].

She says she has been doing this work from a very young age.  She learned it from her mother, so she already has very good experience with it.  She says that thanks to the love she puts into her work she has good results because her articles come out very pretty and this, in turn, helps her to have a good income.  She has been weaving for 40 years, and now she teaches her nieces and other interested girls in the area.  She sells her work through the artisan centers in Carapeguá and also gets orders from Asunción.

She is requesting help from the foundation and from Kiva to buy thread, fabric, dyes, and other supplies necessary to make her embroidery.  She is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead that is being given to her.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Noeline's Group

texts.en:
Noeline's Group is comprised of two hard working women. Noeline is 22 years old, and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past three years, Noeline has been working hard to manage her small market which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Noeline has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Noeline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Noeline hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a big saloon. 

Noeline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Noeline's future prospects by helping her to improve her economic status.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old married to Lucy. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a clothing retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stock clothes and textiles. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a clothes wholesale shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize flour for his shop.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de 9 enfants.Elle vit avec son mari et tous ses enfants dans la maison familiale.Elle tient une petite boutique de vente de produits alimentaire mais s'active surtout dans l'élevage de moutons.Elle achète des moutons de race qu'elle élève et revend au bout de dix à douze mois.Ces deux activités génèrent des revenus assez importants qui lui permettent de suppléer son mari dans la prise en charge de la plupart des dépenses familiales. Elle prend en particulier entièrement en charge les frais de scolarité des enfants, leurs dépenses sanitaires et d'habillement.Pour renforcer son activité d'élevage, elle sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un prêt de 500000f pour acheter dix moutons. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman and mother of 9 children. She lives with her husband and all her children in a family house.  She runs a small shop selling groceries but is mostly in the business of raising sheep.  She buys purebred sheep that she raises and resells after 10 to 12 months. These two businesses generate revenues large enough for her to supplement her husband in taking care of the majority of the family expenses.  Specifically, she takes care of all the children's school fees, medical expenses, and clothing.  To strengthen her sheep-raising business, she is asking UIMEC for a loan of 500000 francs to buy 10 sheep.  Her ambition is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old, and is a single mother of three children. She has been in the quarry business for the past 11 years with a monthly income of Kes 15,000, which she uses to support her children.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Agnes will use the loan to purchase another quarry. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the quarry stones.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry site.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Hawa.  She is married to a mechanic and has 2 children, aged 7 and 16 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her. She came to live with Hawa to attend school in the city and also help with domestic work.  

In 2001, Hawa established her secondhand electrical equipment/appliances, carpet etc. business. She began her business because her parents could not afford to pay her school fees. Since she could not further her studies, she joined her mother in business, and when her mother died she had to partner with her elder brother in the business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,508,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 10 small pieces of secondhand carpet @ Le150,000 each, 10 DVD players @ Le125,000 each, 10 rolls of electrical cable @ Le100,000 each, 10 boxes of plugs @ Le80,000 each and 450 packets of light bulbs @ Le1,000 each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 976,000. In the future, Hawa plans to build a house.  

She feels good that her business is growing.  She is planning to expand and give her children a better life.  She is excited about the future because in acquiring this loan she will be able to buy more stock to add to her existing business. Her major challenge is the high rate of taxation.  Competition is low as she is the only retailer in that area.  She serves people around the town and customers from interior villages.  She serves about 12 people per day as she offers quality products at affordable prices to suit her customers.  She buys her goods in Freetown three times a month through public transport.  She uses his profit to buy more stock for her business.  

Hawa is planning to expand by acquiring more loans and making better profits so that she will be able to achieve her plans.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand carpet, DVD players, electrical cables, plugs and light bulbs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 34-year-old business lady.  She runs a general store to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and employs two people.  Her business has grown since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She thanks Faulu Kenya for training her on business management skills.

She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  Nancy has requested 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.name: Halprat's Group

texts.en:
The Halprat group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Halprat is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells firewood and milk. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood for her business, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Halprat hopes that in the future she will be able to buy cattle. 

Halprat is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Halprat's future prospects by helping her to learn how to negotiate with her customers.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Philimena

texts.en: Philimena is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a teacher. They have six children between the ages of 5 and 22 who are attending school and live at home. For the past twelve years Philimena has been selling used clothes and artificial hair (wigs) in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes and artificial hair for her business. In the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and artificial hair (wigs) for her business.

loans.name: Dorice Nasio

texts.en: Dorice is 36 years old and is married with three children ranging from six to ten years. She describes herself as an ambitious, polite and kind woman. She has been selling clothing material, canvas and linings for the last six years. Her business faces the challenges of low purchasing power and the high cost of materials sold. She will be using the Kes 20,000 to buy canvas, lining and materials. In the future, Dorice hopes and dreams to be a supplier of canvas and materials.

loans.use: To buy canvas, lining and clothing materials.

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de San Pedro se unieron con la esperanza de salir adelante, por medio del trabajo en conjunto y la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se esfuerzan siempre por sus familias. Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y desean llegar a máximo nivel.
Una de las miembros es la señora Mirtha, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Por medio de esto ella puede salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Uno de sus sueños es tener una granja grande donde tener muchos animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, como así también alimento para los mismos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
12 women from the city of San Pedro got together hoping to get ahead by working together and by receiving help from the Paraguayan Foundation. They are very hard working and industrious women who always make an effort for their families. They are in the first level of the female entrepreneur program and want to get to the highest one.
Mirtha is one of the members. She works breeding animals such as pigs and chickens. By doing this she can get ahead and help her relatives. She describes herself as a very hard working and enterprising woman. She dreams of having a big farm in which to have many animals.
She is requesting the loan to buy young animals for breeding, as well as feed for them. She is thankful to the Foundation and Kiva for the opportunities they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding and selling and the feed for them.

loans.name: Mohamed L

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Mohamed L.  He is married to a trader, and has 1 child aged three years old. In 2006, Mohamed L established his fast food business. He began his business because the culture of Fullas prefers business to any other thing in life. He also maintains that culture, so that was why he joined his father in business. After spending several years with his dad, he then decided to stand on his own by setting up his own business centre. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about Le1,888,000 every month from this business.

Mohamed L would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 4 cartons of mayonnaise @ Le240,000 each, 5 cartons of milk @ Le210,000 each, 7 cartons of ketchup @ Le60,000 each, 1 bag of beans @ Le520,000 and 1 dozen cocoa @ Le50,000 each.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 583,000. 

In the future, Mohamed L plans to expand into a restaurant.  His feeling in taking this loan is good as it has helped him a lot.  He hopes to form a classic restaurant with a variety of food in service.  He wants his child to have a better life.  The loan will create a source to generate more income for him.

Changes in the prices of goods that the customers demand is his major problem in this business.  Competition is not too great, as his food service is different from others.  He serves about 50 people per night around the city.  His business is popular because he makes good and tasty food to meet the standard of living of his customers.  

Mohamed has two employees.  He normally goes to Freetown once per month to buy his goods and to Makeni three times per week.  He also goes by public transport.  He uses some of his profit for his business and saves the rest for his future plans.  He is planning to expand by making good use out of the profit he will realize from the business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise 4 cartons @ Le240,000, milk -5 cartons @ Le210,000, ketchup - 7 cartons @ Le60,000, beans 1 bag @ Le520,000 and cocoa 1  dozen @ Le50,000.

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Sylvia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to manage to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 14 and 27, all of whom attend school. For the past five years Kuma has been selling cosmetics. She makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics her business. Kumba plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is a woman with a good reputation. She works hard to help her husband in their living.
 
In 2002, Hanaa started a cosmetics & perfumes trading business in her house. It has improved since she started with the help of a loan she got from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Her previous loan had a positive impact, and that's why she is applying for another one. 

She will invest in her business by buying new autumn-winter cosmetics & perfumes collections. She believes that the new collections will be sold quickly because of the Holy Christmas & New Year's season.

Hanaa is a hard worker. She hopes to open a big shop in the future, and to add clothes to her trade.

loans.use: To buy new autumn-winter cosmetics & perfumes.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Teddy has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids for the hair, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a tailoring business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teddy's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy braids for the hair.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil lives in the village of Kandaura, East Georgia with his family, wife Nanuli, son and a daughter-in-law. Avtandil is 64 years old. He leads the agricultural business of the family. His son works as a driver at a local milk processing company. Avtandil’s daughter-in-law works as a teacher. Nanuli is a housewife. The family has 2 cows. Nanuli produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Also they have a vineyard on a family-owned plot of land and sell grapes. Total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris. Avtandil requested credit for purchasing feed for the cows for the winter months. Also, part of the funds will be spent on modifying the engine of Avtandil’s car to make it more cost effective, in terms of consumed fuel. 

As the cows will be fed well, Avtandil will get the planned amount of milk and dairy products during the winter months. The family will continue sales of the dairy products, which is an important source of the income for them.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows

loans.name: Edwin Kipchirchir

texts.en: Edwin is a single man. He describes himself as a strict man. He has been providing motorcycle transportation services for the last two years. In addition, he also sells timber. His motorcycle business faces a challenge of the high cost of fuel. He will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy timber for selling. In the future, Edwin wants to run a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Zainab Y

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Zainab Y.  She is single and has 3 children aged 19, 13, and 8 years respectively, and all school-going children. In 2003, Zainab Y established her soft drinks, liquor and fruit juice (Bar & Restaurant) business. She began her business because she was in school when she got pregnant. After she delivered; she was not able to further her studies because her parents were not well-to-do.  She had to go into business in order to maintain her baby and herself.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase savanna drinks - 20 crates @ Le120, 000 and frozen chicken - 6 cartons @ Le100,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 358,000. 

In the future, Zainab Y plans to build a club and motel.  This business helps her greatly.  She wants her children to be educated as she was unfortunate in learning.  She is very excited with her business.  Her only challenge is foreign exchange.  Competition is high, but her employees treat customers nicely and provide good food and assorted drinks.  Zainab Y serves people around town and foreigners in town.  Her business is popular because she has good sales people.  

Her suppliers are located in Makeni, Freetown and Conakry.  She usually buys her goods in large stock once per month.  She uses her profit as additional capital.  She is planning to expand as she hopes to access bigger loans.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase savanna drinks - 20 crates @ Le120, 000 and frozen chicken - 6 cartons @ Le100,000.

loans.name: Asenta

texts.en:
Asenta is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.
Asenta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 33 years old, married and has one child.  To earn a living, he owns a motorbike which he uses for a transport business.  He has improved his business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management.  Currently, he has employed four people in his business. David hopes to expand his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy motorbike spare parts for repairing his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Irene is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fish. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to buy herself a plot of land. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Irene's future prospects by helping her to learn how to handle her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale,

loans.name: Santa Maria 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Maria es de la ciudad de San Pedro, se formó con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que trabajan en busca de un mejor porvenir para sus familias. Actualmente el grupo está en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, con 12 integrantes.
Una de las miembros es Nilda, quien es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Comenta que desde joven ha trabajo, por lo que no teme a ningún desafío. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, a la que acuden la mayoría de sus vecinos. Ella sueña con poder creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados, enlatados y demás artículos para poder abastecer su local.
texts.en:
Several friends and neighbours of the city of San Pedro formed the Santa Maria committee of this city. They are all heads of their households who work to achieve a better future for their families. The group, which is made up of 12 members, is currently in the first level of the Foundation’s female entrepreneur program. 
Nilda is one of the members. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. She says she has worked since she was very young, so is not afraid of any challenges. She has a well-stocked grocery to which most of her neighbours go. She dreams of continuing to grow so she can go on helping her family in that way.
She is requesting a loan to buy groceries, beverages, bakery products, canned food and other articles with which to stock her shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, bakery products, canned food and other items.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 32-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked in construction since 2009, and it is his only source of making a living. He is a builder, and he works in most construction fields, especially with tiles.

To improve his business, Rabih requested a loan from KIVA partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary iron pillars for his business. He is putting much effort to prove himself among competitors and to provide his family with the best living.

He hopes to improve his business in the future through opening a big construction company.

loans.use: To buy necessary iron pillars for his business.

loans.name: Yodita

texts.en:
Yodita is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.
Yodita is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rahumuma's Group

texts.en:
Rahumuma's group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Rahumuma is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her small market which sells food. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and take care of her young brothers and sisters. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy herself a plot of land. 

She is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rahumuma's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale,

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years of age, a smart and simple businesswoman in the Municipality of Camalaniugan. She has been in the business of selling beauty products and dry goods for over one year and it is going as planned. She is friendly and trustworthy which is why she gets loyal customers. 

She is requesting a loan of P50,000 as additional capital to purchase inventory of brands like Natasha, MSE, Sundance, Avon and Boardwalk per her customers requests. Hopefully, this loan would make her business more competitive and more productive. This would cover the needs of her two children in school and the improvement of their living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of brands like Natasha, MSE, Sundance, Avon and Boardwalk per her customers requests

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for five years.
Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Su principal objetivo es obtener mejores ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Rosalia es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura, y nos comenta que le va muy bien, pues es muy buena en lo que hace. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le acercan trabajos para hacer.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos necesarios para el taller de costura. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
12 hardworking and industrious women have got together with the aim of getting ahead and helping each other. They are currently in the first level of the Foundation’s female entrepreneur program.  Their main objective is to get better incomes and help their families in this way.
Rosalia is one of the members. She is a seamstress and says that she is doing well because she is very good at her job. She has a good amount of customers because most of her neighbours provide her with work.
She is requesting the loan to buy cloth, thread, buttons and other articles she needs for her sewing workshop. She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and other articles.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronicah is 47 years old and married to Reuben. She runs a grocery store and has been in business for the past 5 years. She earns a monthly income of about Kes 30,000. She is requesting her first loan of Kes 10,000. She plans to purchase stock items for the grocery store. Her dreams are to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia is 57 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 19 and 37. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She has been in the business for over 10 years.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Theresia believes that through Faulu Kenya, she will grow her business because she can easily access business loans. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, soda and eggs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soda and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Luz Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Luz Eugenia se dedica a la compra – venta de carbón a los diferentes restaurantes, asaderos de pollo y todo aquel que necesite desde hace tres años, esta labor la realiza gracias a un amigo de su padre quien le ofreció este trabajo, desde entonces almacena el carbón en un espacio de su casa. Esta actividad brinda el sustento necesario para la señora Luz Eugenia y sus padres quienes tienen 87 y 97 años por lo que tienen que ir constantemente a controles médicos mus costosos, por lo que la señora Luz Eugenia necesita de la compra de carbón con el cual pueda atender la demanda de fin de año y tener los recursos necesarios para cuidar la salud de sus padres.
texts.en:
For three years Luz Eugenia has been buying and selling charcoal to different restaurants, to chicken broilers, and to all that need it.  The work that she does is thanks to a friend of her father who offered her this work.  From then on she has been storing the charcoal in a space at her house.

This business activity gives the needed support for Luz Eugnia and her parents, ages 87 and 97.  Her parents need to continually go to doctors, which is very expensive.

Therefore, Luz Eugenia needs to buy charcoal to be able to take care of the end of the year demand.  She also needs the resources to take care of her parents’ health.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school.  She has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay her child’s school fees. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

She is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has increased Juliet's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.
Jenty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax for candle making

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 41-year-old business lady. She is married to Jerald who is a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a pharmacy for the past five years with a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Rosemary will use the loan to buy more medicine for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a bigger pharmacy, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her shop

loans.name: Sumayiyah's Group

texts.en:
Sumayiyah's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sumayiyah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sumayiyah has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Sumayiyah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Sumayiyah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Sumayiyah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a Wholesale shop. 

Sumayiyah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sumayiyah's future prospects by helping her to learnt how to handle her customers.

loans.name: Silvio Alonso

texts.es: A sus 32 años, el señor Silvio se dedica con su moto al transporte de personas en el casco urbano y veredas del municipio de tamesis localizado al sur de Antioquia. Esta labor la inicio debido a que su trabajo anterior le estaba causando problemas de salud ya que trabajaba con químicos que lo estaban intoxicando.  Actualmente, el señor Silvio permite que las personas puedan transportarse y la economía de su municipio mejore. Debido al invierno, la moto del señor Silvio ha sufrido daños, por lo que necesita de mantenimiento que le permita seguir trabajando y así generar los ingresos para el sustento de su familia y una buena educación para su hijo de 11 años.
texts.en:
Silvio, age 32, uses his motorcycle to transport people in the inner city and rural districts in the Tamesis municipality, which is south of Antioquia.

He started this work because his previous job was giving him health problems.  He used to work with chemicals that were poisoning him.

Silvio currently allows for passenger transportation and for improvement in the municipality’s finances.

Because of the winter Silvio’s motorcycle has been damaged.  It needs maintenance, which will allow him to keep working and generating income to support his family.  The income is also to give his 11 year old son a good education.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on his motorcycle - change the tires, replacement parts, and lubrication.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for five years.
Gloria is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Umar's Group

texts.en:
Umar's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Umar is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Umar has been working hard to manage her small art shop, selling handcrafts. 

To help expand her business, Umar has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making crafts, and will help Umar generate greater profits and pay fees for her sisters. Umar hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Umar is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Umar's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget for her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making crafts

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old, he is married and blessed with two children. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation service for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits from the business for his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras y ven en el programa de la fundación una gran forma de ayuda para cada una de ellas.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Higinia, quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que ella es muy buena en la preparación de comidas. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede mantener a su familia y de esa forma darles lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos necesarios para los alimentos que prepara. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora, of the city of Villa Elisa, is a group comprised of 16 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city.  They are very hard-working and enterprising women and they see in the foundation's program a great form of aid for each one of them.

One of these women is the lady Higinia, who works selling food.  She comments that she has good sales, since she is very good at preparing meals.  Thanks to this job, she can take care of her family and in this way, give them what they need for a life of dignity and worth. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase meat, chicken, seasonings, condiments and other supplies necessary for the food that she prepares.  She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, seasonings, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Fatuma is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her small market, selling fruit.

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruit for resale, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and take care of her children. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Fatuma's future prospects by helping her to her business has developed.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for resale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de preparación y venta de tortas, galletas y postres, ella los días sábados y domingos vende las tortas en la plaza tupac amaru y los días de semana trabaja a pedido de personas en general, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las tortas, galletas y postres. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar y bandejas para implementar su negocio de venta de tortas. 


 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Tinka.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Teodora. She is 42 years old, has a partner, and 4 children.

The member alternates her daily activities. She has a business making and selling pastries, cookies and deserts. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells the pasties in the Plaza Tupac Amaru and during the weekdays she works selling through requests to people in general. Through her work the member supports her children. Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell the pastries, cookies and desserts. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar and trays in order to supply her business of selling pastries.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the agreed terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, and trays to use in her pastry business

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 23-year-old married woman with two children who are not in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.
Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Lornah

texts.en: Lornah is 40 years old married to Jackson. They have been blessed with six children. She runs a grocery store and she has been in business for 10 years. Her monthly income from the business is Kes 3,000. Lornah is taking her first loan of Kes 15,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock (e.g. vegetables, tomatoes and onions) for her grocery store. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profits. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to add stock to her grocery store
